dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A strip of two-lane highway runs through a tall pine fore is a truck-stop coffee shop beside the roadway. A few 14- are scattered across the big dusty parking lot. Morning s glints off their chrome stacks. It bakes the asphalt and mangy hides of stray DOGS asleep in the dirt. A HELICOPTE about the treetops like a lazy hummingbird. It's the begi perfect day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A highway PATROL CAR slowly trolls among the trucks and d parks beside the slat and shingled building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO TELEPHONE LINEMEN are scaling a power pole at the for

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High on the pole, the linemen lean back against their saf to work, their bodies forming a "Y." One of them suddenly pointing at a nearby treetop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lookee there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs a PORCELAIN INSULATOR from his belt, cocks his a hurls it across the open stretch. It lands smack in the m the tree. SQUAWK! A rattle of leaves, a rustle of feather HUGE BUZZARD comes flapping out. The lineman cackles over marksmanship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The big, frightened beady-eyed bird is lumbering through flapping for its life and suddenly...SPLAT! It crashes he 3A   the bubble of the passing HELICOPTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship rocks as the PILOT wrestles the controls. There OTHERS in the cabin. The man beside the pilot, ELI CROSS, sketching in a manuscript and eating an apple. He glances irritation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, will you stop wiggling?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't yell at me...yell at the goddamn crazy bird! It tried to kill us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (back to his manuscript) Oh yeah, that's your story. What's the bird got to say about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli bites into his apple, grimacing at the mushy mouthful it out the hatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The apple drops into the trees, bounces down from branch and falls on the slanted roof of the ROADSIDE DINER benea rolls down the eaves, off the edge and lands on top of th Highway Patrol car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something hit the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So will the Chief...if we don't grab this guy Cameron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They climb out as we see a SECOND PATROL CAR sliding up b MORE POLICEMEN emerge from the second car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They huddle, then move toward the diner entrance.     As open WINDOW the CAMERA HOLDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FRY COOK serves behind the long counter where MEN on st watching the overhead TV. There is a PINBALL MACHINE in a The policemen are seen ENTERING b.g. A TRUCK DRIVER amble straddles a stool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gettin' hot early. It's gonna be a scorcher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fry cook fills the driver's empty water glass from a then move down the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits a few stools away. He's about 25, even-featured, weary. His appealing face needs a shave. The cook fills h glass. The ice cubes rattle as Cameron's hand trembles. H are riveted on the policemen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two policemen take seats at a booth across from the count policeman moves to a WALL TELEPHONE, another stands near REGISTER looking at a magazine. They seem nonchalant, but placed to block all avenues of escape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly startled as someone slaps him on the arm. face the man beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's really a beaut...really a beaut!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MAN is staring at the TATOO which shows below the rol sleeve of Cameron's shirt, a large American Eagle with el scrollwork and a patriotic slogan. The man pulls up his o to show a small tatoo of an anchor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My wife still yells about this...but yours -- that's some eagle...like a billboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyes on police) Yeah, that's the grand old bird. (a half-smile) Right now I just wish the son-of-a- bitch could fly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron rises and moves across the diner to the pinball m

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PLAYER wiggles and contorts, using body English to in balls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Morton, you think your ass is connected to the machine? You wiggle, it's gonna make the ball go where you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 12A   Cameron's eyes scan the room, passing the TV above it, the commercial shows a beautiful girl (who we'll late NINA FRANKLIN) bending over a bowl of dog food. Her ass, 12B   wiggles engagingly. The pinball player leaves the m Cameron, stalling for time, works the plunger while a cop closer; like the cat to the mouse hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you're lucky. Somebody left a free ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron shoots. The ball bounces crazily inside the machi and buzzers flashing. Another policeman approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got 20,000! You're gonna win...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Win what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A free game!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrific...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rests his hands on the machine, glancing about.    Esc hopeless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...that's just what I needed...one more chance to lose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a lightning-swift motion, the cop clamps his hands dow Cameron's wrists, snapping the HANDCUFFS on. The trap has

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron nods his head in resignation. A big uncontrollabl breaks and spreads over the cop's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then suddenly, Cameron bolts, desperately springing full the back door. He flings it open. The cops are moving tow One has almost got his gun out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron!   Halt! I'll shoot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron lunges through the doorway, not realizing in his screen door still blocks his path. He tears through it, b stuck halfway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (panicked) No!...God, don't shoot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swinging his manacled arms like a club against the tangle breaks free and runs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Cameron flies down the back steps, a COP stationed at door, caught off-guard, tries to stop him but is shoved f back. Cameron weaves and scrambles across the yard, over between the shed and the barn, rolling beneath a building other side. Behind him, distant shouts and a gunshot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Cameron runs, he moves with a skill that suggests fore alien to him. He crouches low, following tiny avenues in of tree trunks, scrambling on all fours over needles and cones. Sweat pours down his face. His breath rasps in his He breaks into a clearing and FREEZES...suddenly face to MAN who crouches, blocking his path. It is one of the tel linemen we saw earlier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lineman, kneeling at his tool chest, is surprised by The other lineman is halfway up the power pole. They both Cameron's handcuffs. Cameron edges back, his escape route The man on the ground grabs a WRENCH and moves forward wi gleam in his eye we saw when he scared that bird from the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stand right there like a good old boy and do what I say. You wanna try and mess with me, you've had fair warning. I was a combat Marine in Korea. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lineman advances on him as Cameron backs away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Korea? No shit, so was my old man... (he suddenly stamps his foot and shrieks) Aaaaaaaargh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lineman jumps in surprise. Then, enraged like a start he lunges forward with the wrench. Cameron uses the man's against him, his moves those of a trained fighter. A hard his stomach doubles up the lineman. The handcuffed arms s like a club between his shoulder blades driving him to th A kick thrown sideways to his head and the man is out. Th lineman who had started to descend the pole freezes and t step back up. Cameron grabs the lineman's toolbox in his grasp and dashes off into the forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slides down a slope on a carpet of fallen leaves, tumb bottom and falls face forward into a running stream where his head and drinks. CAMERA MOVES ACROSS the terrain. The pursuers, the forest is silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The jaws of a wire-cutter clamp down severing the chain c the cuffs around Cameron's wrists. He lifts his knee from cutter handle. His arms are now free. He wedges a chisel one bracelet and swings a sledgehammer against it. We hea sharp outcry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doubled up, holding his wrist in pain. The bracelet is st intact. He buttons his shirt cuffs over the metal bands a the slope to the bright sunlight on the road above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron is trudging along the old road winding down throu mountainous pass. He crosses a bridge. Through the arches low stone railing, he sees a BLACK RIVER twenty feet belo toward the sea. Then, glancing back, he is suddenly alert

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the far distance, almost lost in the shimmering heat w the road, is a tiny speck moving toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He clambers down the embankment behind the railing, peeri this hidden vantage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The speck grows larger. The SOUND of the engine is faintl now. Sunlight flashes from metal and glass. Cameron's app suddenly changes to wonderment, for the vehicle is not th he had feared, but something else. Moving in the shimmeri wave is a splendid, high, humpbacked World War I vintage SEDAN with gleaming brass headlights, roaring towards him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He scrambles up the embankment to thumb a ride. The Duese roars past him, filling his eyes and mouth with dust. Sud there is a screech of brakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Duesenberg goes into a skid and then bounces to a sto Running, Cameron reaches the car, pulls the front door op climbs in beside the DRIVER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.    I thought you didn't see me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver, BURT, is a husky, red-haired man about Camero deeply agitated. Pounding his fist against the steering w talks half to Cameron, half to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it.    Screwed it up.   Lost my nerve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fishing a Vick's inhaler from his pocket and shoving it i nostril.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn sinuses. Can't even see straight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron looks at him, puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to drive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt whirls on him, enraged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is that supposed to mean?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) No offense...thought you might...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every one of you jerks is a goddamn hotshot expert! Thanks for the vote of confidence. If you think you can do any better, just come and try it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts his boot in Cameron's stomach and shoves hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron comes flying out and lands on his back in the roa Duesenberg squeals forward, its open door slamming shut f momentum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stunned, the wind knocked out of him, Cameron rises to hi Before the old relic has gone thirty yards, again the bra screech, swinging the car into a sliding salute turn, one eighty degrees and it is suddenly screaming back toward C 28

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driving with one hand on the door handle, his head halfwa window watching the bridge railing and the water beyond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron, sprawled on the road, is momentarily paralyzed a of the Duesenberg's great brass grill bearing down. His h over a rock and with the same illogical gesture that a so flings a Coke bottle at a tank, Cameron hurls the rock in direction of the car and frantically rolls sideways. The spinning tires brush him as they pass. We catch a momenta of the rock smashing against the gleam of the passing win

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he stops rolling, once more face down in the dust, eye expecting death, he becomes aware there is only silence. his eyes, climbs to his feet. The road is empty. The Dues gone. Astonished, confused -- he walks to the side of the where the railing ends and the car might have plunged off nothing below but the rushing black water. Here and there swirl to the surface. They could be from a sinking car or caused by the current.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His thoughts racing. Was it the sun, has he imagined the thing? Suddenly a HELICOPTER appears, hovering, almost at level. Sunlight flashes through the spinning blades like

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is the same helicopter we saw in the opening sequence. swiftly descended beside the bridge just beyond the raili catching Cameron with no chance to run or hide. FOUR MEN seen inside the plastic cockpit barely a few feet away. T beside the PILOT is ELI CROSS. He grabs the radio microph begins speaking into it. Cameron whirls, scrambles down a field. The helicopter drops to within a few feet of the w hovers. Protected from sight, Cameron runs between the ta away from the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glancing back through the stalks as he runs, Cameron sees TRUCK barreling toward the sight of the accident. In the THREE MEN are frantically putting on black wet-suits. The from this distance, like little black toys tumbling again other. Cameron runs on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few hotels, like a cluster of old Victorian gingerbread a sandy cove beyond which is the sea. There is a fishing boardwalk, hot dog stands, pizza parlors, all swarming wi sunbathing TOURISTS. The town's bucolic, turn-of-the-cent might even survive these, if not for a monstrous yellow C CRANE, which juts ten stories into the sky from the cente sandy cove. Cameron appears on the bluff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surveying the town -- expressionless, a jungle beast goin survive no matter what -- at least for a few more hours. down and rips off his trouser legs at the thigh, turning cutoffs a vacationing bather might wear. He pulls off his boots and flings them into the brush, his eyes never leav town below. There are crowds to get lost in down there. H unbuttons his sleeve and looks at the handcuff still enci wrist. Stopping beside a large rock, he smashes the brace against it. It won't open. Grimacing in pain, he re-butto sleeve, opens his shirt and begins descending the palisad the town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SCREEN is yellow and on it are the words: 'HAVE A NIC THE ANGLE WIDENS and we realize the words are on the back YELLOW HAT that jiggles as its wearer walks. It is Camero him we see the tide of tourists in oils and ointments fli the sun. Teenage girls at portable toilets adjusting thei The boardwalk cops in white shirts, looking like ice crea whom Cameron deftly avoids. Then, he looks up at the sky, perplexed: the helicopter from the bridge is overhead, ci Cameron watches it warily as he walks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BIG CROWD has formed at the railing of the pier. Many o people with CAMERAS CLICKING at the sand below. Cameron n helicopter is now sharing the sky with a brightly painted cockpit BIPLANE. It is a WORLD WAR I FIGHTER with BRITISH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron works his way through the crowd. All eyes now loo at the plane. A LOUD VOICE is HEARD coming through an ele BULLHORN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, people. Quiet! We're losing the sun! This is a take! You're welcome to watch, but please, no flashbulbs. They'll spoil the shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron's world has become more ordered again. It's a fil shooting on location -- this somehow must explain the Due His eyes go to the scene below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CAMERA RIG suspended from the end of the yellow constru is PHOTOGRAPHING the surf where EXTRAS in German WWI unif unload ashore. The bright little plane has started a lazy toward the soldiers, its engine whining. From here it loo fearsome as Snoopy and the Red Baron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the British plane pulls out of the dive, there is a tr explosion. In the flash of smoke and flame, barge, rowboa ammunition and people are blown sky-high. The smoke from exploding ammunition momentarily obscures the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The onlookers are very impressed and pleased and then abr pleasure turns to horror and disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the smoke lifts, the Tom and Jerry violence has become horrifying reality. Bodies are scattered about. One man h severed in half, drenched in blood. Chunks of meat, arms litter the beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paralyzed by the sense of catastrophe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting) Something went wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, people begin to moan and scream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Staring tensely at the carnage.      By reflex, a shout e lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Medic!   Get the medics!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 41A   A WOMAN sags into a faint.      A small child in th clutching Cameron's leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the scene continues we hear a voice on the Bullhorn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut!   I said CUT! That's a print.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the reality of the horror turns into an obscene, farce as what appear to be the missing parts of bodies be wriggling out of the sand where the extras were partially create the macabre effect and now the extras become whole beings before our eyes once again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd reacts in various ways. Sighs of relief, laught The exhumed extras wipe sand from their eyes and shake it trouser legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling) Beautiful, Harvey. You gave everybody a heart attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARVEY, the Second Unit Director, yells back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli will hate it. He said he wanted the shot in one? Now watch, he'll do six hours of pick-ups.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd disperses.      A TOURIST turns to Cameron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great...but why do they always use so much blood? It ruins the realism, don't you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still shaken, quietly mutters) ...asshole...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tourist stiffens as Cameron turns away, his attention by the beating sound of the helicopter. He glances up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopter is descending toward the beach while the F rapidly moves equipment from the last scene into piles to landing site.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wary of the men in the chopper, Cameron is moving down th from the landing site. Suddenly he stops short, caught by he sees O.S. Excitedly he points and begins to shout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!    Hey you...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Below him, walking away on the sand is one of the actors same red hair, the same old British army jacket as Burt - in the Duesenberg. Hearing the shout, the actor stops and tentatively turns. It's a mistake. Clearly the features a different. It's not Burt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron is puzzled. He watches as the red-haired actor lo to see who called and finding no one, starts off, but is a LITTLE OLD LADY holding a parasol and offering her auto

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Bailey! Aren't you Raymond Bailey, the actor? Would you please sign your autograph? Write 'to Emily...for eternal peace.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raymond signs the book with the easy charm of a man who's million times. He has those special rugged good looks tha to Marlboro men and movie stars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm certainly glad you're all right. I lost my husband and my son in the wars...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of the chopper blades has become deafening as i for a landing. The Old Lady snatches her autograph book a for the landing site.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As it touches the ground and its doors fly open. Out step CREWMEN and ELI CROSS. The ASSISTANT DIRECTOR rushes up a over the hissing blades of the idling chopper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened on the bridge?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deeply upset) All the divers found in the car was the goddamn camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned) And Burt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (anguished) No Burt! All gone...caught in the current probably and...they're diving downstream and searching the riverbanks, but...don't say anything to the crew yet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Jesus Christ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Jesus Christ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know...call my mother and have her tell me it wasn't my fault... (desperately) ...What the hell could have happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their words are lost in the sound of the rotor as the cho rises. The sudden WIND from its blades blows some screeni pile of equipment. It falls on the Little Old Lady who ha approaching Eli and topples her into the surf. She is tra tangle of ancient skirts and petticoats. Before she can r balance, a wave tumbles her further into the sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron, sitting on the edge of the pier over the water, this mini-disaster. The undertow from the wave has swept Lady directly beneath him. Reaching down toward her, he y

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!   Hey, give me your hand!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't quite reach her. As a last resort, he drops off into the water by her side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs for the struggling Old Lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be afraid! You're gonna be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like groping through seaweed, he reaches past her tangled grasps her waist and lifts her to keep her head above wat choking, gasping for air. She turns her face toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her features are distorted; they seem to be melting away. her hand and violently tears at her face, pulling away th MASK on which is the melting putty and make up. With it g wig and what is left is a startlingly beautiful young gir

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON My God! (choking on water) You're...I know you...that girl from TV...the actress. Nina...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NINA (sputtering) ...Franklin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun glistens on the wet, wild young perfection of her ingenuously sparkling laughter and for an instant it's br - a universal boyhood fantasy to suddenly be thrown this that kind of "movie star" beauty. It's something Cameron the pit of his stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON My God!...Why the hell...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NINA (laughing and choking) ...Makeup test...it's for the film...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Regaining his composure enough to attempt flattery, but h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON They gotta be crazy to cover that face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NINA (laughing) I'm only old at the end of the story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they are only in a few feet of water, there is no long reason to hold her. He starts to put her down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NINA No, don't do that.    Rescue me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON In three feet of water?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NINA Oh come on, please. I always wanted someone to rescue me from something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grinning, he carries her toward shore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli, surrounded by the crew and dozens of tourists, is st the water's edge as Cameron wades in and sets Nina down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina! You damned near scared me to death!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the sight of Eli, she becomes like a little girl who, skinned her knee and run to daddy, now can allow herself

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh hell, it's all ruined now and I wanted you to see the makeup, Eli. Where were you?...I even got Raymond's autograph and he didn't know...You'd have been proud...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina is surrounded by people who are rubbing her with tow pictures, all shouting at once. The CROWD closes in, excl Cameron to the outskirts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the A.D.) Get her into a tub, then bed...and I want to see her in makeup and costume again before dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE CREWMEN hustle her off, as she searches the crowd f Cameron...then spots him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Thank you! That was really gallant...rescuing an old lady!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron waves and starts to wander off as they whisk Nina

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves toward Cameron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a second!   I want to thank you, too!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Eli trots up, Cameron tenses, finally facing this man from the helicopter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't run away.   What is that, a habit with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON Yeah, I also smoke too much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI You and Burt on the bridge...how about telling me what happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli begins to stroll along the sand toward the pilings wh the pier. Cameron hesitates, but Eli's manner compels him follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON I don't know. He must've gone crazy. He tried to run me down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI Oh?...Why would he do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON (flustered) ...I didn't ask him why! All I know is he was comin' at me very fast. (quoting an axiom spouted by top sergeants in a thousand boot camps) 'You want to get home for Thanksgiving, you better figure the guy comin' at you is tryin' to kill you'...That's one thing I learned from the gooks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI Gooks?...That has a nostalgic ring...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have reached the pier.   Eli stops, he is watching s O.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI (CONT'D) You guys really used to call them gooks? I thought that was just Time Magazine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was 'Nam. What should I call 'em, WOPS? Nobody'd known what I was talkin' about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to follow Eli's gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A POLICE CAR has driven onto the beach. From it, THREE OF have emerged. They are armed and efficient looking. The P MANAGER moves to greet them. Eli takes Cameron's wrist an pulls him back into the shadow of the pilings, (privately to the handcuff he feels beneath the shirt). JAKE, the Ch irate enough to be clearly heard from this distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, this time you've had it! Where is he?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief, I'm glad you dropped by. Eli says you gotta do something about all these people on the beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bellowing) Thirty minutes is what you've got to get your goddamn equipment off this beach and out of town!...You tell Eli Cross if your men are on the streets after four o'clock, I'll throw their ass in jail!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli squats down on his heels and leans back against a pil smiling up at Cameron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speaking of jail...would you get upset if I asked how many cops were after you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly grim) What are ya talkin' about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI (off-hand) Your I.D. bracelet...the look on your face...the way you ran from the bridge... (with exaggerated delicacy) I...don't suppose you want to tell me what you did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron studies Eli, not knowing what to make of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON No...I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI (brightly, with humor) ...Could I try categories?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron half laughs despite himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI (CONT'D) (glancing O.S.) Ever done any stunt work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI How'd you like to be a stunt man? You look like you're in pretty good shape, fast on your feet. You could do it. (getting to his feet) Besides, You're not gonna have much choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake has spotted them and is approaching with his men and Production Manager. Eli puts his hand on Cameron's should steps out into the sunlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI (softly, to Cameron) Now, don't get hasty. And, remember your ass, it's just like mine... maybe I can save them both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRODUCTION MANAGER (trailing after Jake) ...but we've gotta have three days to finish this picture...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE (striding toward Eli) You said you'd be gone four days ago, before the season started. You lie, break promises... (he is now close enough and shouting at Eli) Cross, I've gone out of my way, but this time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TRAM beeps, clangs and passes between them, interruptin leaving him sputtering. As it departs, Eli seizes the mom

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI Jake, it's been a rotten morning. You're hot and tired. Let's go in, have us a drink and find out what's eating you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE (turning beet red) Don't treat me like these other morons! You know goddamn well what's eating me is that Duesenberg on the bottom of the river with the dead man in it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is silence. Eli stands thoughtfully kicking the san toe. Then Jake starts shouting again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE (CONT'D) I mean, that is a goddamn public bridge and a public river! You go there without permits, without any precautions and get a man killed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI (gently) Jake...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE No more bullshit explanations. Just go...before I figure out how to hang you with a manslaughter charge!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a pause; quietly) No explanations...don't have any. But, maybe he does... (staring at Cameron) Go ahead, ask him, Jake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli's words are exploding in Cameron's mind -- that illus on the bridge has crystallized into hard reality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON (wide-eyed) ...Now wait!...You're not blaming me for...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI (wheeling on Cameron) Why not, Burt?! Because you're a fake?! Because you're just a goddamn daredevil with a head full of marbles?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron vaguely understands that Eli is trying to pass hi Burt and that he, somehow, may be saved by going along wi madness. Eli, turning to Jake, continues passionately...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI (CONT'D) He grabs the bread, blows the shot, screws you up...screws me up. He's dumb, Jake, but thank God, he ain't dead yet. So do me a favor, put your handcuffs on this son-of-a- bitch and put him some place where he can't get hurt!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Chief is dazed. If this is Burt, the stunt man, he is alive. Jake goes to Cameron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE How did you get out of the car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI He didn't get out. Our divers got him out...and brought him back in the chopper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Chief stares at Cameron. His clothes and hair are wet is a small bruise on his cheek from when he fell out of t Duesenberg. He looks the part. Jake turns to Eli with res

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cross, when these three days are up, I'm going to arm my men with shotguns and tell them it's open season on any fruit carrying a camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks to the waiting police car, surrounded by TOURIST pictures. He glares at them, angry at the world. Eli puts on Cameron's shoulder and leads him through the dispersin toward the hotel. Eli is now easygoing and friendly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI You did that very well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON I didn't get a chance to say a word. I just listened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI There are only a few actors in the world who have mastered that art. Anyway, it was a good audition. You landed the part.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON How? What about the crew? They going to look at me and say, 'Hi, Burt?'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI Unless you prefer, 'Hi, Elizabeth.' Don't worry about my crew, they'll call you anything I want 'em to. Look, I'm not being callous. Burt is a fucking tragedy, but there's nothing in the world I can do about it...I've gotta have this location for three more days...and you need a place to hide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have reached the steps of the HOTEL. A BUS has stopp front. TOURISTS are piling out. The POLICE CAR pulls up a nearby. Jake and his men can be seen surveying the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A.D. (shouting in b.g.) Eli! The crew's waiting.   We need the next setup!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hand! Close-up of the hand!      Be there in a minute!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A.D. An Eli minute or a real minute?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli turns back to Cameron as they mount the steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON By tomorrow the local cops'll know what I look like. I can't hang around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI (expansively) "Burt," stop worrying! Haven't you heard of "movie magic?" (pointing to the etched glass doors of the hotel) That door is "the looking glass," and inside...is Wonderland. You're gonna pose as a stunt man, who's posing as an actor, who's posing as a character in a movie...who's posing as an enemy soldier...In that big a crowd, who's gonna notice you? People like to believe in things and cops are just people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The have reached the front door.   Eli holds it open for

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI (with mock confidentiality) Frankly, your problem's so simple, it's almost beneath me. Have faith, 'Alice.' Close your eyes and enjoy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In exhaustion and resignation, Cameron nods and wearily c eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DENISE'S VOICE Open your eyes...and don't touch. It's wet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes open. He stares at his face in the mirror, pleas subtle transformation. His hair has been cut shorter and somehow changing his whole aspect. He rubs the red mark o wrists where the bracelet has been removed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Part of the laundry room is being used for the film's Hai Department. Cameron sits in a barber chair wearing a plas surrounded by dryers, wigs, etc. In b.g., washing machine constantly. DENISE, the Hairdresser, an attractive earthy thirty-two, stands over him. He is still wary and trying show it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking in mirror) ...Could be worse...could be green...I think I like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course you like it...ask anybody... Denise gives great hair. Got any grass?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) Nope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She touches his hair to test the dryness, holding her han a moment longer than seems necessary. He grins at her, ri crosses to the wall mirror to get a better look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What else don't you have that I need?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves to a basement window and gazes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the window, the crew is setting up a shot while E rehearses with Nina and his red-haired male star, RAYMOND (who Cameron earlier saw on the beach). Bailey is dressed World War I British aviator and Nina as a young girl of t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our male star isn't going to like you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON (moving toward window) Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DENISE You're too good looking. His idea of a perfect stunt double is two- hundreds pounds of hamburger in a red wig...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He studies the view, his attention focused on Nina.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON What's she like? I've seen her on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DENISE (irritated by his interest in Nina) At selling douche powder, she's fabulous; dog food?...I'm not sure she's sincere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON What are you sore about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DENISE I'm not sore. Isn't that what you wanted to know? (with sarcasm) ...Or did you mean, what's the real Nina Franklin like--without the greasepaint and tinsel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moving to a pile of laundry heaped on the floor, she poke with the toe of her shoe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DENISE (CONT'D) ...You mean, what's she like -- underneath?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snaring a crumpled garment, she kicks it toward Cameron, it instinctively, then holds it up for inspection -- a pa (Nina's) lace panties. He grins, mildly embarrassed by th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moving toward him) What do those say about the girl who wears them? Shy? Delicate? Sensitive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches for the panties, but instead takes his hand a sharply, pulling him off balance, falling back on the lau with Cameron on top of her, their faces inches apart; sur his, amusement on hers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (touching his hair) Still wet...very wet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron is trying to remember: what was it Eli said? "Clo eyes, relax and enjoy." Across the room the washing machi whirl and heave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli and his crew are shooting a scene: a "pick-up" shot f explosion sequence we saw earlier. Eli and GABE, the came lying beside the camera. Before them, the "severed" arm p from the sand in which its owner is buried, out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure he can breathe? (a mumbling assent from beneath the sand) Where's Raymond? (Raymond kneels beside him) Remember, you just crashed...you were wandering the beach behind the German lines looking for a place to hide when you saw the explosion. You're stunned by the carnage. That bomb was dropped by a guy in your squadron. Okay? Roll the film.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the CAMERA, WE SEE the 'arm' protruding from the HEAR o.s. VOICES yelling: "Turning"... "speed"... "action the fingers begin to move spasmodically. Eli's voice yell Raymond!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the fingers on the hand start to swell, bigger a bigger...like a rubber glove filling with air...then BANG BANG! The (balloon-covered) fingers EXPLODE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone has broken up with laughter at the prank, includ Gabe is patting Eli's face, Raymond squeezing his jaw aff as one would a pet dog's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cackling) Gotcha that time! Didn't we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through his laughter) Yeah, you got me another half-hour behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli climbs to his feet as the laughter subsides. Cameron, wearing a uniform exactly like Raymond's, watches from th sidelines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently, grinning) Thought the chief could use a little cheering up today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning quiet and serious) ...So you heard the news about Burt...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding) Any more word?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bitterly) Afraid not...there's no picture ever made that's worth it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) I'll never understand why these guys do it -- take the chances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thoughtfully) Don't know. Trying to beat the system, I guess...we all know that some day we're gonna die of nothing more important than wrinkles...and that makes us so scared and crazy, we'll do anything. Go off bridges...fight windmills...wars... anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is great sadness among them.     Eli breaks the moo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what our film's about -- or didn't you know? (sees Cameron) Hey, Burt, come over here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron crosses to them. He and Raymond stand appraising other, red-haired men in identical uniforms. As Raymond o hand:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Eli) My new cock and balls?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quickly) Not new...It's important not to let that get around as yet. So, for the time being, let's make like he's the same guy. (adding a touch of color) But no longer known as "Bad-assed Burt." Ever since his 'fortunate rescue,'...we call him "Lucky."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHUCK BARTON is a tall, rugged-looking man in his mid-thi Stunt Gaffer on Eli's film. A MESSENGER trots up and pres receipt book. Chuck sets down his stunt bag and signs it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your film from that camera in the Duesenberg's on the way to the lab. Put it on the plane with my own little hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When do we get it back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MESSENGER Don't know. Stamped it "rush."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHUCK If I stamp "rush" on my mare's ass, she'll still take eleven months to foal. Call the lab and find out when! (quietly) I lost a man today. I wanna see that footage and find out why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Messenger leaves, Chuck strolls over to where Came waiting, circles around him, sizing him up. Cameron is no wearing the uniform, but now is in jeans and a work shirt

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHUCK Done any stunt work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON Not really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHUCK Not really?   You have or you haven't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON (good-naturedly) I got out of Vietnam in one piece. Let me tell you that wasn't a bad stunt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHUCK (skeptically) That's ancient history.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON Seems like yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHUCK (pointing at church steeple) Could you jump from that tower to the that roof?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gauging the fifteen-foot gap between the CHURCH STEEPLE a of the nearby MUNICIPAL BUILDING. He unconsciously grimac four-story drop between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (being glib) Once, to save my ass, I jumped out of a banana tree into an oxcart full of buffalo shit. Does that count?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll see.    Put these on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws Cameron some knee pads from his stunt bag and b marking off two lines on the bare earth between the grave the churchyard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (puzzled by the pads) Where do they go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tapping his knee) Under the pants. (pointing to lines he has drawn) I want you to jump from here...to there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron hops up to the starting line, finishing with the clumsily, surveys the distance of not more than seven fee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okie-dokie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Makes a casual jump, landing on the line and looking at C approval.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very good. Except you're dead!! Your brains are scattered all over the goddamn pavement. You landed on the edge and fell backwards four stories. Where do we send the body?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON (returns to the starting line) Don't bury me yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a running start and leaps hard.    While he's st air, Chuck yells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHUCK You're still dead! You fell over the other side of the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron has landed three beyond the mark and looks up at shaken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHUCK (CONT'D) You wanna try it right, once? You should land in a tuck-and-roll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON Show me, sergeant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuck launches himself head-first. His hands touch the gr beyond the second mark to break his fall, easing him into roll, he somersaults to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON Very fancy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a running start and does the same.   Not quite a well enough. As he rolls to his feet:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHUCK Better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON My speciality is Hopscotch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuck turns on him enraged, overreacting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Burt's specialty was drowning. You know one goddamn daredevil on this picture was enough! What the hell was Eli thinking, giving me a smart-ass, cocky, amateur kid when I need a stunt man! It's a little different running across that roof when they're pumping tracer bullets over your head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eloquently pleading his case) I was running for twenty-six months with guys shooting at me...not over my head...at my head and I'm alive. I knew daredevils. I got nothing against them...it's just they're all dead. So ease off and give me a chance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron is surprised to see that Chuck is grinning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (genuinely) Hey, were you putting me on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?   I wouldn't know how to do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuck starts to walk away, then stops and looks at Camero

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pained) Can you imaging Eli doing a World War I picture without horses? Do you know the gags I could do with four runaway horses pulling a caisson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron sailing into the SHOT. Chuck ducks slightly, catc Cameron on his back and flipping him into a somersault. C lands on the sharply slanted slate roof of the municipal Chuck stands beside him straddling the peak. The church s be seen in b.g. (and we now realize time has passed and w longer in the graveyard of the previous sequence, but ato building).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Next time hit me higher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (climbing to his feet) What's Eli got against horses?    I love horses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't butter me up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron goes running at Chuck and once again flies over h shoulder. Sprawling on the slippery slate, he looks up to strolling down the hazardous incline like a mountain goat scrambles to follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he walks) We'll draw a sight line for you to follow down the roof here, while you're rolling. Now there's nothing very difficult. But this is where you gotta think. Your mind can't be on snatch. It's gotta be on grabbing that gutter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have reached the lower edge of the roof.    Cameron the drop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or my brains are all over the pavement again, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (walking away) You know a good falling horse makes more money in four minutes than a bank president does in a year?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picture's not over. Maybe you'll still get your chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuck has stopped and they peer down through a skylight t crew is setting up a shot in a room below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sadly) Naw, all they care about is story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move to another edge of the roof overlooking a NARRO COURTYARD. They gaze down at a WINDOW AWNING two stories juts from the side of the building-wing across the court.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now here's where the scuffle ends. When the pipe breaks loose, you fall and hit that awning. Then Eli yells "cut" and old Raymond takes your place for the close-ups and the glory. That's where the German soldiers catch him and throw him in the nuthouse. They're shootin' that scene downstairs now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staring at awning) That's supposed to hold me? Probably doesn't hold rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not a real awning, it's a catcher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron's face is beginning to sweat and the veins are bu the growing strain of some physical effort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's no harder up here than it is on the ground...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PULLS BACK to reveal Cameron dangling from a secti gutter, four stories above the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the same gag...it's just a little scarier. And that's what you get paid for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (alert) Yeah, how much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're stealing candy with this gag. You get six hundred bucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost falling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Christ! Watch it, will ya? (helping Cameron onto roof) What did you think a stunt man is? He's a professional. If the camera jams, that's another six hundred and if Eli says "try it again," six hundred more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exultantly) Yahooo! Six-fucking-hundred-bucks!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a large vacant hall on the ground floor of the municip building, a movie set has been erected representing the w a World War I military asylum. In it, Eli's crew is filmi sequence -- a dozen enraged INMATES in tatters, heads sha eyed, advance toward Raymond, shrieking (as though in ech Cameron's exultant yell).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raymond, dressed as a British Flyer, his face bloodied, c retreats in terror, a man caught in a nightmare, as these derelicts suddenly swarm over him. One, like a mad dog, g his throat, another wields his own artificial limb as a c Raymond (in character) breaks free and screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...STOP!...Get away!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For an instant, the inmates stop in stunned silence -- br by a distant shout overhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the roof overhead) ...Six-fucking-hundred, gorgeous, beautiful dollars! I can't believe it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The slavering madmen look up, then out at the camera, mad longer, simply bewildered actors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. Hold it! Hold it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli stands amidst the camera crew photographing the scene waving for order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI ...Save it, everybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A.D. (storming in) Jesus Christ, what the hell was that? Somebody get their ass up on that roof...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI (cutting him off) ...Never mind. I didn't like it anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Eli steps down from the DOLLY, a solemn, quiet man app from among the onlookers. It is SAM BAUM (the writer).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAM What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI The scene's wrong. (yells to the A.D.) Call a break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The A.D. Calls "Five minutes" and the crew moves toward t urn. Eli wanders toward the door, Sam pursuing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAM (fighting for his scene) Eli, it played like a dream.   My God, it was Marat-Sade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI (glumly) It played like shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (desperate) Well, who was that on the phone in the middle of the night when you first read it, raving about the magical madhouse scene, the upstairs maid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli rips the page with the "madhouse scene" from his scre they stride out of the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There, beside the rear entrance on a pile of construction Eli, cross-legged, staring morosely at some kids who play He is absently folding a torn script page into a paper ai Behind him, at a respectful distance, stand the Productio A.D., half a dozen assorted crew chiefs and Sam Baum, all concerned. Sam looks at the others, shrugs and approaches squatting beside him on the sand pile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you wanna do, Eli?... They're all waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While Sam talks, Eli takes a fistful of sand and pours it shoe. Suddenly noticing, Sam yanks his foot away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (irritated) Being childish isn't going to help your movie...You know, there's nothing wrong with the story. (removing his shoe and shaking the sand out) The real problem is since I wrote this thing two years ago, you've had Watergate, the energy crisis, Women's Lib, the economy is down the tubes...You want to talk about burning issues?...There's arsenic in the glue on the back of food stamps! That's why you don't like the "madhouse scene." Your goddamn war story has lost its relevance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be negative, Sam. We can start a new one in time for the preview.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam has finished replacing his shoe and Eli pours a fistf into Sam's other shoe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut it out, will ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli is at the head of a long table, CAMERA PULLING BACK T dozen members of the company dining with him. Nina sits b listening with rapt attention to Sam's monologue, her des sensuously lingers at her lip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two years ago you were all charged up to make a great big anti-war statement and they wouldn't let you. Now they let you, but you haven't got a war. What you've got is egg on your face because Vietnam's long gone and it's too late!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our picture's not about fighting wars...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...It's about fighting windmills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truth in Eli's statement registers on Sam. Cameron si down the table, watching Nina watch Eli...and wishing she watching him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: War isn't the disease...It's only one of the symptoms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hooked) What's the disease?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI That's the big question, Sam. Name the disease and you've licked the screenplay. (indicating Cameron) Ask him. 'Cause he knows what the film is about. Right Lucky? Tell 'em...How'd you like Vietnam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON How'd you like bubonic plague?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI You drafted?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI See, Sam? Here's another one who hates war...but he enlisted. (to Cameron) You fought in Vietnam for two years? ...I mean actually were out there killing people...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON ...Hey, I didn't kill that many people...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI Don't be modest, Lucky. Everybody digs a little violence...What was that you said on the beach?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron is starting to bristle at Eli's needling, particu Nina watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON About what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI About getting home for Thanksgiving?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON (tentatively) ...that you better figure the guy coming at you is trying to kill you...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. See, Sam?...That's what the disease is about...being scared shitless. Inventing enemies. Whistling in the dark. I wish you'd talk to the kid, Sam, I mean it. You know, really, you guys should room together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAM (getting the last word) Hey, Lucky, give me your cot by the window and I'll let you read a great madhouse sequence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAM (surrendering) All right, Eli. I'll write you another scene. What difference does it make? The studio will cut it all out anyway and what you got left is a lot of swell battle scenes, which, when I was back there they said were "just terrific."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI (simply) No, they won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAM Yeah, what makes you different?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI (quietly) Because they know if they cut my picture, I'll kill 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The deadly in Eli's voice was more than intended and ther suddenly an awkward silence at the table. Cameron eyes El wry smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON You mean, bang? Kill 'em, just like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (matter of fact) No. I'll kill 'em and eat 'em...I hate to waste anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) They call him "Eli the Terrible..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, my picture is the only kid I've got! If the studio said your daughter, Jennifer, would look better with her fingers chopped off, what would you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Being an insecure writer, I'd call my agent...and get another opinion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake, the Chief of Police, is seen in the background appr table. Cameron spots him and starts to rise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...If you'll excuse me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (arriving) Don't go away, Burt.   I want you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (broad welcome) Jake! Long time, no see. You taken care of my problem with the beach?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not talking to you. (to Production Manager) I understand you got that film out of the Duesenberg...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting in) It's at the lab, Jake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm talking to this gentleman. (to Production Manager) We want to see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron, realizing the film might disclose his presence o bridge, reacts with alarm, which increases as Eli says...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell the Chief it's our pleasure. Soon as it gets back...but ask him why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (choked up with its importance) You can tell your Mr. Cross this inquiry comes from a source so high it is not his to question... (now at a loss for proper words) ...it is his to do it, or else. Someone they're looking for may have been on that road when the car went off. (to Cameron) Burt, you see anybody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, suddenly noticing something different about Cameron appearance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, did you have red hair before?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating Denise) She sprays it every day so I look like Raymond...I didn't see a soul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the rescue) Tell the Chief that Burt was so busy being brilliant, he wouldn't have noticed Jesus Christ walking on the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake pulls a PHOTOGRAPH from a manila envelope and hands Cameron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wire photo, front and side views of Cameron, taken at h induction. War ages a man...he looks younger and quite di his GI Haircut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Burt! You got it upside down. The eyes go on top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron hands the photo back to the Chief, who passes it table. Denise receives the photograph, studies it and gla Cameron, expressionless. He returns her gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple of telephone linemen say they saw him headed this way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli takes the photograph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like a nice clean-cut kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know about fifty guys who don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd he do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Production Manager, ignoring Eli's question) The minute that film gets here you give me a call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yawning and rising) I don't know about those fifty guys, but I know one weary guy who's gonna crawl upstairs and hit the sack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli looks at Cameron with grudging admiration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know a weary guy who's driving to Cape Long to dance and booze all night...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (camping, takes Gabe's hand) I know a weary gay who's going with him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They mince off (the fag act all the more amusing because Raymond's strictly masculine looks). Eli shouts after the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So long as you're back in ninety minutes. It's a work night for some of us. (loftily) ...Those who give a shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raymond "gathers" Nina along the way, wrapping his arm ab shoulders -- Cameron watching silently. Then, charging fr the dining room like a tanker steaming in their wake, com gushing, overwrought, blue-rinsed MATRON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Franklin! Miss Franklin! Your 'Feminique Spray' commercial is on TV. My God, it's simply heavenly!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drawers are slamming open and shut as Cameron hurriedly s few belongings into his pockets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a mean little bedroom, with Sam's clothes, typewrite evidence. Seeing Sam's wallet, Cameron pulls a wad of mon it, at the same time accidentally knocking Sam's false te dresser. He hesitates, then stuffs back all the bills but He strides to Sam's closet, pulls out shirt and slacks, s in a cloth beach bag, also belonging to Sam and starts ou Then he stops, gets on his hands and knees, looking for t teeth, which he finally finds. Now, annoyed at himself fo "nice guy," he throws them carelessly on the dresser and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Cameron moves down the steps, the returning company ST pulls to a stop in the driveway. Nina, Raymond and a few emerge from the car. Cameron turns away so as not to be s they pass him on the steps heading for the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bet they're looking for that nut who killed all those campers in Montana...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (drunk) ...Too many campers, weed 'em out! ...Imagine, sitting an hour at a roadblock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should have waited, it wouldn't have been an hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 74A   They've entered the hotel. Cameron continues to the stairs, hesitates, looking back at Nina.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silhouetted through the etched glass doors (on the other "The Looking Glass") he sees the lithe, gay, exquisitely figure of Nina -- light sparkling from the cut glass danc her face -- a hauntingly romantic image.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He watches for a moment with hopeless longing. Finally, t from her, he looks about at the dark water and deserted b There come some of Eli's crew, laughing, joking, cutting through the stillness, pushing their heavy brutes toward spot to light a night shot. There's the CHURCH TOWER. He it, wavering in his resolve to leave, wondering what woul if...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What next? Do you rescue the maiden from the tower?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has come up behind him, unnoticed.    He turns, start there she stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON (smiles) Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a moment they search each other's eyes -- for intenti she glances at the tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NINA Yes. It does look pretty high. (with concern) Are you worried about tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron's mind is racing over all the things he'd like to would know him instantly. But his answer is simple and so sincere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON Not much. I guess if there were any real danger, Eli wouldn't let me do it, would he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NINA (quickly, reassuring) No. I'm sure it's safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON (abruptly, with a boyish grin) Good. Then you jump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NINA (laughing) Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She understands the slightly jealous rebuke for her blind Eli. Her laughing answer hangs like a challenge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON Well, come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NINA (willing, but flustered) What, right now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a moment he weighs it: whether to "run" or stay. Then his decision. Starting to laugh, he takes her hand and pu toward the tower. She holds back, struggling playfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, I'm afraid of heights!   What if I freeze up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulling her along) Don't worry, I'll give you a push. Isn't that what a pal's for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is crowded with bells, a small walkway and railing sur them. The city lights are seen beyond. Below are the shed crewmen are preparing the next day's shooting. Just beyon overwhelming silhouette of the huge CRANE. Nina and Camer the top of the stairs winded and laughing, as they rush t railing and lean over. Nina gasps, clutching Cameron in g fright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gasps) Oh, my God! It's terrifying! You can't jump from this...you'll get killed! It's crazy!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) ...It's not that bad. It looks worse at night... Chuck says it's like robbing a candy store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting angry) Now stop that! ...I'm going back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She whirls to go.   He stops her, taking her by the shoul

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her concern for him has turned to anger, like a mother sl child for running in the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just dumb...to strut around trying to talk brave...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His arm still restrains her. She takes hold of it, then s softens with a look of slight surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh...you are scared...aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seriously) Not really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.   You are...You're trembling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment, he answers quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So are you...and you're not even gonna jump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's true. She is trembling and so is he -- not from fear slowly draws her toward him, her mouth reaching up to his they are devouring each other. Abruptly, they're illumina fierce blast of white light. They separate and stare, bli shock and confusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, hit two and three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are pinned in the crossbeams of two more giant arcs. she yanks him down with her out of sight behind the raili

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli is lounging in the bucket suspended from the crane. Gabe adjusts one of the giant brutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (business as usual) I could kill this brute and fill with juniors. You'd get a halo around the tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (struggling to resist) Got no time...it's an establishing shot...two seconds on the screen. (giving in) ...You got six minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe smiles, scurries off. Eli glances at the tower, grin toyed with them long enough, he yells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! While you're up there, be useful. We're lighting. Stand up and look towards the sea so you're in profile!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Nina's arm raises into view with the middle finger ext

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hollering) Light this, Eli!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The church door swings open. Nina and Cameron emerge, cov their embarrassment with bravado. Nina is prattling as th tour guide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...And those bells are so interesting. Imagine four hundred years ago by boat from Amsterdam. Thank you for the tour. It was so informative. I'm going to write my father. He's so interested in God and things like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiya.   Want a lift?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli miraculously appears from above. He descends and ride beside them in the bucket of the crane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ducking) Oh, for Christ's sake...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There once was a maiden fair, smooching a guy with red hair...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli, get away with that thing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI ...Could it be Raymond who's turning this dame on? ...Or his double, young Lucky Pierre?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unable to elude Eli in his basket, Nina turns on him in m frustration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NINA It's gotten to the point where I have to look under the stopper of the bathtub when I take a shower to make sure I've got some privacy! (broadly gesturing to group) Thank you one and all and good night!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Privately, she gives Cameron's arm an affectionate squeez disappears around the corner of the building. He is left the beach bag, pursued by the Peter Pan in the basket. It dropped to ground level so Eli is looking up at Cameron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI Step right in, folks...the "Killer Crane" ride of the century.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON Thanks, I'll walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli's basket now moves up a few feet so he's looking down Cameron, riding beside him while he walks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI Ah, youth. Six hours in town and caught with the leading lady. Not bad. Shouldn't be so upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON Okay to be upset about what happened in the dining room? Why'd you promise to show that cop the film? He'll recognize me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI You really don't trust me, do you? Hop in. I got a present for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls Cameron into the basket beside him so unexpected Cameron drops Sam's bag. Eli picks it up and plops it int Cameron's lap. Suddenly Cameron finds himself soaring sky stomach-churning rate -- while Eli rattles on...probing, quixotic...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You constantly amaze me. You don't go to movies. What's that tatoo, a disguise? You a Commie? Don't you know that King Kong was only three feet tall? He came up to Fay Wray's belly button. If God could only do the tricks we can. What are you worried about the film and the cop for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, hanging ten stories above the city, Eli is adjusting viewer, looking at a cluster of RED FLASHING LIGHTS IN TH He hands the viewer to Cameron, who looks through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 81A   We see a telescoped view of THE POLICE ROADBLOCK at highway with cars waiting to get past ARMED POLICE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muttering) What am I worried about the cops for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another one over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 81B   THE VIEW WHIPS to a second police roadblock at the town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a pair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (puts viewer down) Is this my present?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, your present is a piece of good advice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI (patting Sam's beach bag) You've got that look again. That gleam of the sprinter about to set a record for the 50-yard dash. Is that why all those cops are chasing you? What are you, some kind of sex freak running across America with your fly open? Is that why they're after you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON You're close. What's your advice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI Button your fly and be at the airport on Sunday at three o'clock with the rest of the crew. Climb aboard our chartered 707 and fly away with us to where the setting sun bleeds into a million swimming pools a man can hide in. You do swim as well as run?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON (overwhelmed by the offer) I'll swim like a fish. You really mean it? (Eli nods) Why are you trying to save my ass?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli hesitates, then answers quietly -- for him there is g meaning in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI ...Because you're as crazy as the guy I'm doing the picture about. (then grinning archly, the mood broken) ...Besides, I've fallen madly in love with the dark side of your nature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thunderous clang of bells! Cameron ready, coiled tigh pounding as loud as the bells. A burst of machine gun bul through the railing beside him, sending splinters flying face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARVEY (Second Unit Director) and CAMERA OPERATOR behind MITCHELL, looking up tensely. Harvey gestures, yelling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Near Cameron, the SECOND A.D., crouched out of sight with talkie, stabs a finger at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go!...Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A burst of tracer bullets streak past Cameron. Sparks fly bullets seem to bounce and ricochet off the bells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
