dialogues.text: A 50-calibre MACHINE GUN, a SPECIAL EFFECTS MAN in Levi's shirt, pumping tracers past the bell tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Second A.D. slams his hand down on a PLUNGER, setting series of explosive squibs. Like machine gun bullets, the shattering the railing, moving toward Cameron, forcing hi edge of the tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vaulting over the rail, he clings to the side of the bell Explosive bursts disintegrate the railing in his hand. He out, launching himself into space. Twisting, hurtling acr gap between the buildings, falling, crashing to the slate crawling and scrambling for a hand hold. The relentless t bullets chip the slate beside him. Crouching low, Cameron animal, moves across the roof to the safety of a water to Squibs burst over his head and spouts of water stream fro tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moving around the tower, suddenly there are TWO GERMAN SO running at him with bayoneted rifles. He wheels and there ANOTHER GERMAN (Chuck), who leaps toward him, slamming do rifle butt. The blow glances off Cameron. They grapple, k clawing, rolling down the steep slope, picking up momentu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The roof's edge rushes toward them, below it a fearsome d Cameron's hands reach out desperately grabbing for the ra Chuck, screaming, hurtles off the edge, writhing as his b in space toward the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweat pouring from his face, a gash on his cheek gushes b eyes glazed, he pulls himself back on the roof. 89

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuck, lying relaxed on the straw and mattress safety pad caught him on the ground, looks up, cups his hands and sh Cameron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go!...Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron, running for his life along the edge of the roof, soldiers shooting down at him from the roof's peak. He re far end, looks down. There is the awning jutting from an wall two stories below. He scrambles off the roof. Clingi down spout, he starts descending it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking up from the ground, he yanks a control rope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bracket holding the down spout breaks loose. The spou to fall away from the side of the building. Cameron cling riding its downward arc as though it were a falling tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the end of the arc, Cameron throws himself free for a landing and smashes against the awning. Instead of holdin apart like paper and, in that unexpected instant, Cameron widen in genuine terror as he plummets through the shredd toward a skylight one floor below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exploding in a shower of glass and wood as it is struck b body. He hurtles downward toward a blur of images.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collapsing from the impact of Cameron's fall. The MAN and were making love on the cot have been flung to the ground entwined with him. Cameron is dazed. Like a drowning man, to free himself from the tangle of naked limbs and smothe A painted face shrieks in laughter -- as the door to the in is thrown open, revealing:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron has fallen into a cubicle in what appears to be a I German army brothel. In the high-ceilinged room, there of cots separated by makeshift screens. COUPLES jump up f cots startled. A line of partly naked GERMAN SOLDIERS wai turn at the whores have broken into shouts and laughter a unorthodox entrance. They crowd around the cubicle where fell and now struggles with the couple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe at the EYE PIECE, Eli beside him, photographing the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep rolling! (calling out to soldiers) The clothes!...Do the clothes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men tear him free from the couple shouting playfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dialect) What are you a field marshal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SECOND MAN (dialect) Wait your turn like the rest!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron's confusion changes to helpless fury as he kicks struggles against a forest of grasping hands ripping his away, passing him back toward the rear of the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THIRD MAN (dialect) Where are your manners?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHORE (dialect) This is a whorehouse, not a stable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whores have left their cots to join in the assault, scree glee. As he maniacally lashes out at his good-natured mol the blood from Cameron's face smears a whore's body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI'S VOICE Cut!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instantly everything stops. Cameron is sprawled half-nake knees at the end of the line. Enraged, he whirls toward E caused this humiliation. Then the CLAPPING begins, the CA CREW applauding his stunt. People slap him on the back ad A robe is thrown around him. He is helped to his feet. Su Nina is there flinging her arms about him and kissing him mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NINA I'm so proud of you...I could just die!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is pulled away from her by the backslappers. Now Camer responding to this strange new sensation -- the warmth of acclaim. He regains his poise, hoping his embarrassing an noticed. Chuck is now beside him, reaching up to the woun Cameron's face and pulling away the plastic makeup patch blood inside; the "wound" is gone. He starts feeling Came shoulders, arms and ribs for possible damage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON (quietly to Chuck, wincing in pain) Why didn't you tell me about the awning? I could have been killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No chance. You were in your mother's arms from the time you hit the sugarglass skylight. Those stunt men you fell on would have got you out of anything.

dialogues.text: Cameron ambles over as Chuck reverses the film to see it time. Even as he catches a glimpse of the film whirring b he realizes he's seeing BURT'S DEATH SCENE in the water. has reached the beginning of the film and is moving it fo again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The film whirs as we see through the windshield over Burt shoulder, the car flying through the air, hitting the wat sinking beneath the surface. Burt goes through the motion trying to free himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The harness is okay...the roof is holding...it all seems fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But look at him struggle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Badly. Eli wouldn't use a foot of it...poor slob died for nothin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweat is running down Cameron's face.    Finally, with dr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That crack...in the windshield...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about it? Probably from the impact. No water coming in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron's face reflects immense relief. At least he's not that. The flung stone was not the cause. Now, abruptly, B body begins to move more violently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There! Look at that. He's starting to panic. Will you, for Christ's sake, tell me why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Chuck slows the film, we see Burt's head duck beneath the underwater camera, leaving only the steering wheel an windshield. For an instant, the current changes the light crack glows brightly, like a spider web. Burt reappears, now toward camera, wild with terror. The slow motion lend bizarre elegance to his agony. Abruptly, the FILM GOES BL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. That's where it stops. That fuckin' Henry...got spooked and took his finger off the remote button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this how the story was supposed to end, with the flyer dying in the water?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure as shit ended that way for Burt, didn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In one of the private DINING ROOMS off the lobby, tables are pushed against the wall to make room for a rehearsal progress. Some early morning TOURISTS have gathered outsi entrance, watching. A few members of the kitchen staff pe an inside doorway. Sam and key crewmen stand on the sidel Eli rehearses with Nina.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI (gesturing) The graveyard's over here... (he takes a few steps) ...Her car's parked here. (sets down a folding chair) ...Lots of these little graveyards along the roadside...most of the stones are unmarked...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes Nina by the hand and pulls her down beside him, the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI (CONT'D) You're tired...you're broke...all things which meant so much are gone. What's left is a single memory... that brief bright love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina's listening intensely but something catches her eye. tourists at the doorway stands Cameron, who has paused to costume slung over his shoulder. He nods to her with a sm smile. Subtly, so Eli won't notice, she smiles back, then her concentration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI (CONT'D) ...You spent your month's pension in hiring the car. You just can't look for his grave any longer...so you pick one...any one. You kneel... then lay the flowers down. (yells to the prop man) What have we got for her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PROPERTY MAN I got roses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI No...something she picked herself... wildflowers or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam crosses over to them and kneels beside Eli and Nina.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitantly) Eli. An idea, maybe. Instead of flowers, what if she brought him the things of their life together...of their sexuality...like her nightgown, her underclothes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli looks at him thoughtfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Course they'd be rags by now, but let me show you this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From a paper bag, he takes a SMALL BRONZE CASTING of a BE GIRL on a SWING beneath a tree. He sets it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam's hand presses a lever on the side of the bronze. The whirring of the clockwork and a music box melody plays. T begins to swing. The bear slides toward her. She mechanic lifts her bronze dress until they meet, performing their love rite. Nina giggles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's authentic. Early Victorian. Mechanical bronzes were quite a thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli shakes his head patiently, kindly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, you'll get a belly laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?   It'll break their hearts!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli begins to beam. Sam, realizing he has again fallen in trap, winces, chagrined. Eli grabs him in a bear hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to the picture, Sam!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam struggles to escape from the iron grip as Eli dances in joy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Denise, with spray can and fingertips, is massaging in re the CAMERA PULLS BACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw, nothin' too unusual today...get run over by a tank, blown up by a land mine, a house falls on me... Easy stuff, but I can use a rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...And some manners. As one of the world's greatest middle-weight lovers, I hate to play a one-night stand. I heard you been busy, but you know the old saying...like, if you can't come, call?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (appeasingly) I wanted to, but I was scared. They're so square where I hail from. Twice is considered a love affair...didn't want to rush you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Three times is a love affair. Twice is nice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling) Hey Denise, for Christ's sake! We got a set call in forty minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To include a MAKEUP TABLE against the far basement wall w ACTORS sitting at it, wearing plastic aprons to shield th uniforms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Cameron) You just sit here...dry...and repent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She crosses to the men at the makeup table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glad ya could tear yourself away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't panic. He's still got that whole big emotional thing to do with the dog food lady before they even get to you. You may not work 'til midnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wait. Eli'll wave his wand and get it out of her in five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trimming his hair) You're confused...He got it into her in five minutes. To get it out of her...it takes longer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is general knowing laughter as Denise crosses back and sees by the look on his face she has hit her target. thought of Nina and Eli as lovers had never occurred to C

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oops...somebody didn't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The effect is stronger than she had expected.     Now com in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Hey. C'mon, Red...I'm a woman scorned...I'll say anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron just sinks back in the chair, slowly dying.

dialogues.speaker: "MECHANICAL BRONZE"
dialogues.text: 132 Over the tinkling sound of the music box, the BEAR and MA perform their ritual as the CAMERA PULLS BACK revealing t GRAVESTONE decorated with the worn filmy lace undergarmen another era. They flutter in the soft wind and amber ligh summer afternoon, strangely beautiful against the mossy g marked "UNKNOWN." Somehow these rotting women's underthin the dignity of a sacred tapestry draping an altar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...You terrible bear... so impatient... tearing something so beautiful...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ANGLE WIDENS and we see Nina, now made up to look wri gray, tragically old, her eyes moist as she kneels beside

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OLD LADY (NINA) (sudden deep sincerity) Why do I lie? I couldn't wait either. I think both of us are bears. (a soft nostalgic smile) Go, young maiden, you'll be late for your piano lesson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An elegantly-dressed CARIBINERRI (ITALIAN POLICEMAN) appe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARIBINERRI Signora...signora...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OLD LADY (NINA) I'm almost finished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARIBINERRI Signora. This desecration... some flowers perhaps...would be permitted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OLD LADY (NINA) But, we want these.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARIBINERRI Please, signora. It's not right. The grave is unmarked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OLD LADY (NINA) Ask the driver how many graves we visited today. I could have chosen five hours ago. I came here and my soul said, "Oh yes." I know that is hard to believe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARIBINERRI (shrugging) Anything is possible, signora. (tries urging her to her feet) Now, you must permit me to escort you to your car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OLD LADY (NINA) As soon as I am gone, you will take everything away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARIBINERRI No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OLD LADY (NINA) (tears streaming down her face) You will, and I can't stop you, and it's wrong. We loved each other... Where else should these go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The unexpected sound of laughter makes her turn to see a OF PEOPLE who've gathered beside their PARKED CARS watchi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OLD LADY (NINA) Yes, I know I'm ridiculous, but you laugh without knowing anything. You would buy a plastic wreath for a man of such importance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls free of the Caribinerri and, trying to kneel do stumbles and falls. Now, like some confused child, she se among the garments. Taking a SCROLL from a wooden box, sh it at them like a schoolteacher would a ruler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OLD LADY (NINA) President Wilson...from the President of the United States...for heroism. To me for sheltering him... (smiling to herself) How silly. I 'sheltered' him to be with him. He was my beloved...Where is it?...Oh, here, did you see this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She now holds up a fist from which dangles a swastika on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OLD LADY (NINA) Given to me by Adolf Hitler...for our son. Our son...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her voice suddenly fierce with the pain of that memory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OLD LADY (NINA) ...Our son!!! (then, with simple reverence) ...A thousand years of peace...is what he said. That would be very nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Caribinerri, spellbound, has taken a backward step, b a REFLECTOR, which now teeters and falls into the scene, off his hat, barely missing the Old Lady and crashing acr grave and shattering all illusion. The Caribinerri stands

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: with his eyes closed and his fists clenched, wishing he w grave. Nina stands in speechless horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Cut...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli, I'll kill myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and print.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's deadly silent as Eli walks over to Nina.    They sta other for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyes brimming over) Thank you, baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They fall into each others arms like lovers never do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody is applauding, wild with joy over Nina's great performance. Tears of happiness run unabashedly down Sam' Only Cameron is sullen, seething with anger and jealousy them in the light of his recent information.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through bull horn) All right, that wraps the graveyard. Don't pack it...just stick it in the truck. Come on, we're losing sun, everybody. In ten minutes at the farmhouse!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron is standing aside, while Nina vainly looks around Denise is unpinning her wig. Chuck approaches Cameron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHUCK Change of plans. We're making the stunt a fire gag. When you come out of the barn, you're in flames...wanna try it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron, still watching Nina and Eli in the now dwindling admirers, doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHUCK (CONT'D) Look, don't do it if you don't wanna...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON What does Eli say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHUCK You know Eli... "Tell the soldier it's an extra hundred bucks and he'll do it without the asbestos." Whaddya say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON Tell Eli to do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHUCK Hey, what the hell is wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON I'm tired of being somebody's goddamn clown!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI (moving into the shot) Hey, you don't want to do it, don't do it, but be happy! It's a great day! Did you see her performance? Terrific. It's a day for humility and brotherly love!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON Fine, Eli. Let's be brotherly. Milk brothers, sucking from the same tit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As it explodes, Cameron is BLOWN THROUGH THE WALL -- ON F tumbles to the ground, frantically writhes, rolls, trying the flames, finally collapsing in some wagon tracks fille muddy water. Cameron lifts his head at the approach of a SOUND...an ENGLISH CAISSON hurtles toward him, the driver mangled over the barrel of the gun, the horses insane wit Before Cameron can move, the charging horses are on top o rolls between their hooves, the giant steel wheel of the barely missing him. Shells from a cannon barrage are burs about. Cameron staggers to his feet and scrambles over a wall for protection, drops to the other side and then hur the air as the wall is shattered by an exploding shell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Cameron falls into the shot, landing on a hidden TRAMP the stone wall, bouncing up and down 'til he finally come

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who said that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron stares over the edge of the trampoline as Henry, assistant cameraman, uneasily faces Eli.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had a film run-out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Gabe) How many feet are left in that camera?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checking the Mitchell) Thirty-six feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli advances murderously on the assistant cameraman, buil rage we have not seen in him before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn you! How many times are you going to do this to me? How dare you yell cut on my set?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defensively) Thirty-six feet is nothing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's twenty-two seconds! In twenty- two seconds, I could break your spine...I could pinch your fucking head off like an insect and smear it on the pavement...I could put twenty-two bullets in that fat gut of yours! The only thing I can't seem to do in twenty-two seconds is keep you from fucking up my film!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron is so intrigued that he hasn't realized an EMBER through his asbestos protector, until suddenly he feels t and frantically begins beating it out and thus, is even d pleasure of savoring Eli's anguish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosy-faced and dewy-eyed and wearing a big floppy hat. Se trouble with Cameron and that she might be at fault, she to do a campy, cutesy Blanche Dubois stepping off "THE ST NAMED DESIRE" number, ten years too soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (southern-belle sarcasm) ...I can't tell you how pleased I was with your conduct. When you congratulated me after my scene this afternoon, all the other glowing tributes faded to nothing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam has stopped typing and sits silently, waiting for the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron lies on his bed in a T-shirt and shorts, an elast around his knee and an ice bag at his neck, coldly watchi performance as she grandly moves through the doorway into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NINA (CONT'D) ...Nevertheless, I'm cancelling your invitation to an intimate party given by my parents, who arrived unexpectedly to honor me on the occasion of my birthday...but don't feel too badly. As consolation for a lovely evening missed, I'm presenting you with the "good-sport- of-the-month" award.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From behind her back, she takes an APPLE with a tiny cock parasol stuck in it and holds it out to Cameron. Cameron glaring at her with mounting rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NINA (CONT'D) Mr. Baum, will you notify this young savage that it's customary to cover one's privates when accepting an award? It's one of the common courtesies, like...congratulating people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON (coldly) What should I congratulate you for? The fucking scene or for fucking the director?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina stands there shaken, looking at him sadly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NINA For fucking the director, honey. (biting into apple) Didn't you know that's how little girls get into the movies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leaves. Cameron lies there seething, then abruptly le storms into the bathroom. Sam sits rubbing his head, resu typing. Cameron rages out of the bathroom, flings himself bed. Unwinding the elastic bandage, he sprays ethyl chlor knee. Sam's typing stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAM (quietly) Young man, taking my life in my hands, I must inform you that you are an asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron ignores Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAM (CONT'D) Being a devout masochist, it follows that I'm Eli's best friend. I know quite a lot about him and Nina.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON You and the entire crew, buddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAM (wryly) He met her three years ago. Two lonely people rattling around New York. A brutal winter. Eli's marriage had just broken up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON (interrupting in anger) ...All she had to do was tell me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAM'S VOICE She could have done that in four seconds. They went to bed once and they were lousy as lovers. But they had a problem. They liked each other. They recognized some area of mutual sensitivity. I'm boring you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON You telling me he banged her once three years ago?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAM'S VOICE (disgusted) I'm going to see if they can put me up in the employees' toilet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He begins to type again, then philosophically...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAM'S VOICE (CONT'D) I think he 'banged' her twice to confirm the awful truth...Was she supposed to be a virgin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he says this so sadly and looks so miserable that Sam has reached him and it touched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a virgin once. Had to go to Guatemala for it. She was blind in one eye and had a stuffed alligator that said, "Welcome to Miami Beach!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron sits there feeling dumb and full of regrets. Then up, goes to Sam's closet and begins rummaging through the Sam watches him curiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how's the new ending coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got fourteen versions. Take your pick. (worried about his clothes) What are you doing in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overly casual) ...Fourteen gory ways to die?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirteen. In one version he lives...turns the girl in, opens a gay bar in Berlin, gains fifty pounds and changes his name to Goering... (now deeply concerned) ...Please, anything but the sweaters. You'll stretch the hell out of the sleeves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pleasant SEAFOOD RESTAURANT is on the pier over the w Cameron, now wearing Sam's sweater after all, is searchin crowded room trying to find Nina and what might be her fa is about to leave when he sees a group at a window table, WOMAN in their early fifties and a FOURTEEN-YEAR-OLD GIRL attractive despite the baby fat. Something about the comp all their features is familiar enough to give them a seco In doing so, he sees a half-eaten BIRTHDAY CAKE on their front of an empty place. He goes to the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitantly) I was sort of invited to a birthday party and I can't seem to find it...and this seems to be a birthday party...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FATHER, a hearty, bluff, good-natured man, looks at C amiably and with a father's intuition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A birthday party is a birthday party...sit down. (Cameron does) Who was this birthday party for... animal, vegetable or mineral?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NANCY, the fourteen-year-old, giggles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Mineral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you stop teasing this young man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's really worth finding, ma'am. She's a very rare mineral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleased with Cameron) How old is this mineral?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This morning she was acting about ninety, but she might be lying a year or two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The father now really comfortable, recognizing a fellow h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you got the wrong table...this one's acting like she's six...but the missus tells me birthdays are very emotional for the ladies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At this moment Cameron can tell from their faces that the Nina behind him. He turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina has emerged from the ladies' room looking miserable walking toward them. At the shock of seeing Cameron, her to her mouth in such embarrassment and joy and confusion she feels, that she starts back to the refuge of the ladi Catching herself, she turns back to face him, her eyes no with tears of happiness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves forward and kisses Nina. We now realize we are a HOTEL ROOM DOOR. She on the inside, he on the outside, ki through the doorway, which stands slightly ajar. With the barely parting:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry it got so late...that damn five o'clock makeup call...I feel as bad as you do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the same place I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you take a raincheck? (slipping her room key in his pocket) ...A permanent one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts his hand on the pocket and grins at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A season pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Closing the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On HENRY (the ASSISTANT CAMERAMAN who Eli screamed at), h beside him, his elbows, empties, loose change scattered b on the bar top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking up) Lucky...hey Lucky, come over here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE shifts to include Cameron a few stools down.    He his beer and crosses to henry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HENRY (CONT'D) Guess who tole 'em to take their job and stuff it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON Ya quittin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HENRY Fuckin' A. Gettin' out tonight. But not without splittin' a Schlitz with the one guy, 'cept me, who wouldn't take shit from that screwball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the BARTENDER is taking away the empties, Henry puts h down on a DIME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HENRY (CONT'D) Change is for you, except that. That's a very special dime. (holds it up for Cameron to see) Know what this is? Ask me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON It's a dime...am I close?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HENRY It's Eli Cross' ass. People think 'cause you're easygoin' they can walk all over you. Bull-shit...I'm blowin' the whistle with this dime in that phone...killin' a man and hiding it from the police...are you kiddin'...? Who is he think he is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron pales, knowing that drunken Henry's desire for re expose him to the police. He grabs the dime from Henry's and drops it into a PEANUT VENDING MACHINE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HENRY What the hell you doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron stuffs the bag of peanuts in Henry's shirt pocket suitcase and hustles him out of the bar toward the FRONT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm putting you in a cab for your own good and sending you to the airport. He's mine, Henry, all mine. Just leave that son-of-a- bitch to me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have reached the HOTEL DOORWAY.   By now, Henry is c Cameron means business. He stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HENRY Do whatever you wanna do, but I better do it with ya! You'll need help 'cause that goddamn looney is dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON (blustering) Not to me, he ain't. I'm going to the cops. You gotta earn your living in pictures, but I don't give a shit. He can't hurt me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HENRY Don't be too sure. Damned psycho nearly strangled me! Don't believe me? Wanna see marks...? (tears open shirt collar to show bruises) ...Lucky to be alive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON (confused) Henry, what are you talking about? I watched that whole thing today, he didn't even touch you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not today. When Burt went into the water. (Cameron is wide-eyed) I could tell from up there in the chopper something' was wrong. So, I stopped shootin' and that crazy man gets me by the throat and starts screamin' to roll the film...I mean that guy's down there dying and he's screamin', "Keep shooting! Keep shooting!" Then, he starts fighting me for the switch and it falls down...like a crazy house up there, with him thrashin' on the floor...He didn't care about Burt. All he cared about was to get that man dyin' on film! Sickest thing I ever seen!

dialogues.text: As Henry's last words sink in, Cameron stands pale and sh

dialogues.text: Cameron, realizing for the first time that instead of bei or frightened, she is livid with rage?

dialogues.text: CAMERON (ironically) Then gee, ma'am, I sure hope you didn't tell him about all that ballin' last night.

dialogues.text: Nina lets out an incoherent roar of rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NINA Goddamn you! The wounded stud! He is entitled to some dignity! To lose his "pure and faithful lover" without the new boy barging in! Where do you suppose he is now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GET OUT!     Get the HELL OUT!!

dialogues.text: Cameron crosses to the door. Searching through this madne some kind of logic, turning on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON (interrupting) The word is "fuck!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NINA All right, the word is fuck! You narrow, insensitive, stupid...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NINA Believe in what? You're blushing. A place where what? Don't get embarrassed at this late date!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON ...A place where a guy has a right to blow his top if he finds his lover screwing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NINA (interrupting) Raymond's lover! Raymond's lover! Say it! Raymond's lover!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron, exhausted, slides down the wall and sits on the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NINA (CONT'D) (quietly) You won't turn me into some rotten whore because your papa once told that a woman is a certain way "and that's how it's gonna be 'til Gabriel blows his horn..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON (wearily) Okay...okay. I just want to sit a couple of seconds without having to say a word. Because if I start trying to say, "I'm sorry I caught you and Raymond fucking," I'll start laughing and when I laugh too hard, I get the hiccups and they can last for days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NINA (after a long beat; softly) Don't get hiccups.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON (quietly) Isn't anything what it seems to be?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NINA (quietly) No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Don't you think that's kind of lousy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Yes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit there unable to leave each other, unable to move other. They just sit there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dailies are in progress. Eli watches, surrounded by a few members. Cameron sits in the back row with Nina's MOTHER, and SISTER. Nina is not present. On the PORTABLE SCREEN i of Nina as a wild, radiant eighteen-year old Austrian gir pell-mell along a willow-lined VILLAGE STREET, dodging ch 148A   bicycles. She collides with an OLD MAN, her basket contents scattering; his momentary anger vanishing as he with her joy of life. He helps her refill the basket and rewards him with a sausage and a kiss. The old man watche wistfully as she runs away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a tear of pride in Nina's mother's eye. Father ge his hand on top of hers as the room lights come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay back there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy as clams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (brightly) She's so beautiful. Isn't it amazing how they put it all together and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Eli is already involved in the SCRIPT GIRL's notes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...132 through 40 next? Sam should see this. I think I left in a line of his dialogue. (yelling to projectionist) Go ahead.

dialogues.text: The room dims and the film starts. We see a slate board r "150A Take 1." The clapper claps and the board is removed revealing an ATTIC. Nina sprawled on her stomach, stark n Raymond's naked body, her breasts resting on his chest, h apart, interlocked with his. They look directly at the CA awaiting their cue with the calm resignation of two peopl for the Wilshire bus. The MAKEUP GIRL appears in the shot Nina's back and ass with glycerin sweat from an aerosol c disappears as Eli's voice on the sound track calls, "ACTI ANGLE TIGHTENS into a less revealing, more artistic compo Their mouths meet. Their bodies writhe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stare at the screen in open-mouthed shock and horror once gentle hands grip each other like iron claws, trying away the nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In shock and anger, leaning forward on the edge of his ch looking from Eli to the parents, not knowing what to do t this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (upset) Sweet Christ!   I told 'em to hold that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (starting to leave her seat) I'll stop it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (restraining her, resigned) Too late now...only make it worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lovers convulse with erotic abandon as they approach

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like a Charles Addams' rendering of a Brady tintype. Thei wear the stiff frozen smiles of the hopelessly insane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's now made up to look like a woman in her forties. Ev about her tells us these have been brutal years, filled w and loss. She is reacting in anguish to something O.S. Bu though she manages a few tears, it doesn't quite ring tru steps into the shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the crew, O.S.) All right, save it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the sidelines, as he coldly watches Eli put his arm ar and stroll her away from the crew so they are out of ears

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina. The shame of it...the shame! You've lost your son, your lover. You want to tear his throat out... but you stand meek...your guts burning with the shame of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, I don't know what's wrong with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has looked up at her parents, who stand off to one si zombies, watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's them...I feel like I'm in a zoo. Let me say bye-bye and get 'em on their way. It might help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts to move towards her parents but Eli puts a res hand on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (upset) Honey...you better know this...don't get all shook up now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina looks at him with foreboding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something got screwed up...the dailies...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The attic scene. The bare-ass attic scene... I'm sorry... I don't know how... it was too late to stop it... your parents...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has not blinked, not turned her heard, for fear that father's eyes might meet hers. She is like a statue tremb earthquake, about to shatter. The sick, loathesome shame her, brims over and the statue's blind eyes flow tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tense, barely breathing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (an urgent whisper) ...Roll film.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He eases back out of view.    The ANGLE SLOWLY TIGHTENS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she falls apart before our eyes, and an O.S. VOICE on TAPE insinuates into our consciousness, echoing as though through many loudspeakers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I envy you the pride you must feel today. A young hero has fallen gloriously on the field of battle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hands reach in and drape a sash around Nina's throat. Fro dangles a SWASTIKA. For Nina, there is still no voice, no only the obliterating shame for that image of her naked b into her father's memory. And yet, that shame is so simil shame she should be feeling as the woman in Eli's film at mockery of her son's death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A nation has lost a son! A mother has lost a son!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound has now grown to a proportion reminiscent of th newsreels of Hitler victory rallies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This sacrifice in blood brings closer man's noblest dream...a thousand years of peace!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The THUNDEROUS SOUND of ten thousand voices shouting: "Si Sieg Heil!" has shattered Nina's isolation. She is now aw her personal despair has been used to accomplish an actin and it only adds to her degradation and sense of shame, i making her performance even more poignant. The crowd on t playback roars with fanatic zeal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Striding rapidly down the hall, looking like a man who ho a fight, to dissipate his residual anger. He rounds a cor almost colliding with Eli, who comes rapidly from an inte corridor. Eli puts his arm around Cameron's shoulder, hur along even faster.

Cameron is suddenly alert like a beast who's just heard the trap slam shut behind him. His around at the official-looking faces staring at the O.S. face looks disturbingly familiar, but in the dark he can'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: I don't see anybody else on the road...did you, Burt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Cameron follows Eli as the lights go out and the film beg

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something wrong?     Why are you lagging?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: (chewing gum) Hey, kid, what is this with you? That red dye must be eating through your scalp and affecting your brain. Why would I want to hurt you?

dialogues.text: I think it's beautiful. It's heroic! I think it's a major work that may rank with the Edsel grill! Now goddamnit, I gotta go back and do my picture! Will you take this thing and read?!

dialogues.text: He holds the booklet out to him and it is very hard for C reach out and take it. Out of the corner of his eye, he s FBI MEN leaving the building, heading off in another dire stares at the booklet.

dialogues.text: Chuck keeps an eye on him.

dialogues.text: He's dangerous to have around. Stop playing games, Eli. Tell Jake you've replaced him. What are you so hooked on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit.

You read about it in the paper two or three years later...some kid in a bell tower shoots a dozen students for no reason at all...his mother says he was always such a good boy...I guess I'd like to know what he really did.

dialogues.text: Did you bring the tampax? Raymond's still acting like he's got the "curse."

Each is talking himself, adrift in his private world, unaware they have l with the other. The room is semi-dark, except for the nig light on Cameron's side, by which he studies the BOOKLET him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...It was so unnecessary...For Christ's sake, I'm no shrinking violet...I've had my ass pinched black and blue by account execs for not showing enough enthusiasm for Vitalis. But this from Eli...it was so pointless...sadistic...

dialogues.text: (reading) ..."Open All windows slowly to keep pressure from caving in the roof, should an unexpected skid achieve aquatic consequences..." That's kind of witty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say it was an accident...benefit of the doubt. But then to use me that way...like a gadget...Why would Eli do that? He's not a cruel man...

dialogues.text: (not looking up) He's not a cruel man.   He's a crazy man. A maniac.

dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading) "The water pressure at two hundred feet can crush a man into the size of an egg." He wants to get that on film....so he's gonna kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jumping out of bed) What in God's name are you babbling about?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a rotten shame about your folks and your naked ass, but dying always scared me a little, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
