dialogues.text: CAMERON Did you know that Eli almost strangled a man because he stopped the camera when Burt got killed?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NINA What is going on in that head of yours?! You take the word of some...malcontent...technician!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON ...I saw the bruises!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NINA ...And I saw Eli that night when he had to tell Burt's brother on the phone...I saw the tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON She saw the tears! Did you ask him what he was crying about?! 'Cause you can bet your sweet tits, it wasn't over Burt. He was crying over losing his fucking shot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To keep from exploding, Nina opens her luggage and furiou repacking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NINA Didn't they give I.Q. tests in the army? What did you get...minus twelve? Haven't you figured out yet why he's working himself to death? What his film is all about? He's trying to tell people not to kill each other!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON And you know what? You want the shock of your life...? I understand what the son-of-a-bitch is saying, and he may be right...which makes me what? Minus twelve, the dumb schmuck with a gun. That doesn't change the fact that he's crazy. If he had his way, there wouldn't be a soldier left alive by morning. But

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: all he's got on hand is me. I don't know if he is doing it consciously, but it's a hell of an idea. If he can really get it on film, a genuine dumb fuck grunt cashing in, before your very eyes, I mean the real McCoy...that's gotta help his picture...Then he's killed two birds with one stone. It's got a nice logic. Trouble is, both birds are me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Against her instincts, Nina is emotionally affected by wh says.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NINA Stop it...sweetheart...I'd die if anything happened to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TELEPHONE RINGS. Her head whips to look at it.     It ringing, but she doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NINA It's my father...I won't talk to him...You're all driving me crazy...I won't talk to him.!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron calmly picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON Hi...hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NINA (whispering) Tell them I'm not here. Tell them anything. Tell them I'm working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON (glancing at Nina) Okay, Chuck. I'll meet you in an hour. (he hangs up) For me. Amazing how they keep secrets around here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks over to the still-stricken Nina and tenderly emb She leans against him, the trembling subsiding. CAMERON What if I told you I wasn't going to do the stunt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NINA I'd say fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON And what if I told you I was gonna get out of here tonight...and that I want you to come with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NINA (upset and confused) But there's just one more day of shooting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON What if I can't wait?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NINA I...I have two more scenes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON That's a shame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NINA ...I could meet you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When he doesn't answer, Nina resorts to her last defense, anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NINA (CONT'D) ...Look, don't do the stunt! If you believe Eli's a killer, call the police...Why are you doing this to me? That's all I need right now, with all I've been through!...For you to give me now-or-never ultimatums and tell me my director is insane!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By now she is stalking about the room throwing things fro suitcase to another as Cameron silently watches her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which stands alone like Moby Dick awaiting its victim. Ch Cameron appear from behind the car, stalking it like it w Sunday Special on a used car lot, Chuck the "hearty" sale Cameron the reluctant customer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this mother...I'll bet these guys could build an Arabian out of a jackass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?   You built a stunt man out of one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stunt man? Three days and you've already grown those big brass balls? Jump up and down and let me hear 'em clang, and then do me a favor and leave 'em home for this gag. (yanks open the door) There's just enough room in that Duesenberg for a normal guy...who thinks! (Cameron slides in) Show me how long you can hold your breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron inhales deeply and Chuck clicks his stopwatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHUCK Now, look around. Whaddya see?...No roll bar in the roof. That's because the roof caving in really looks gassy on film. You got your protection in the back of the seat...steel sheeting. If the roof goes too far, you get your goddamn head down quick! You listening to me?!...Nod Your head. (slapping Cameron on back) You got good lungs. (buckles Cameron's seatbelt) You got no shoulder harness because it would show on camera. So when you hit the water, you brace yourself against the steering wheel. It's reinforced. You couldn't break it loose with dynamite...you gettin' light-headed yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron shakes his head, "No."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHUCK Keep your hands off the doors... You're leaving through the window. You lower them slowly as you sink to equalize the pressure. What are you waitin' for? I'm not gonna be down there holding your hand. (Cameron lowering windows) Slower. When you hit bottom, the windows are open and you're gonna make like a minnow. But first, a little fresh air wouldn't hurt. You reach down under the seat and, what do you know, a respirator...Make like you're reaching for it. There'll be one there tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron reaches for the non-existent respirator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHUCK (CONT'D) No, keep your face forward, the camera is behind you and it's still running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By this time, Cameron's breath is giving out and he's str hold it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You feel like your lungs are gonna burst? Good. That's the way you're supposed to act like you feel. The moment that water gets above your nose, you gotta look like you're drowning. Remember? Burt wasn't so good at that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That knocks the wind out of Cameron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sure as hell convinced me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuck clicks his stopwatch and scowls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defensively) Things happen crossin' the street! If somethin' goes cockeyed...screw the scene!   Get that mask on. There's enough oxygen to get you to China. (rolls up the window) We'll try it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still panting) Let me catch my breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you'll catch is a lungful of water! You're at the bottom of the river!...You breathe when I goddamn tell you to breathe!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (the pupil tricking the teacher) Hey, Chuck, you blind?...Can't you see I've got my respirator on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just goddamn remember you don't have gills!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 169A   Chuck has stalked over to the WORKBENCH and angril PHONE, which has been ringing incessantly over the last f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting) What?!! (listens, then yells to Cameron) Eli's at the police station!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the best news I've heard. Let's hope it's a felony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He needs Gabe. They're lookin' for a driver so I'm gonna take him. Come on with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (climbing into the company car) You and me are gonna talk about windows and oxygen and seat belts and things like that. And if you're a good boy and listen and don't be a smart ass, maybe I'll let you sit in the back seat with Nina Franklin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuck, already in the car, is grinning.   Now he's even f "respirator" bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You might even get to hold hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The POLICE STATION comes into view, seen through the wind company car, which slows as it moves toward the curb. Eli on the front stoop, leans wearily against the stone lion. sees the car approach, he moves toward it quickly, openin almost before it stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beckoning) Gabe, Nina...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli pulls Gabe and Nina toward the police station, yellin Cameron and Chuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You two better wait here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron watches them, confused, as they start up the step the station house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate this, damn it! Couldn't you have done it without me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's say you owe it to him. Until two or three days ago, I had a pretty good actor on my hands. Next time you take out the clippers, be a little humane, make sure the guy's got one to spare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (furious) What did you want me to do? Take him in the back room and unzip his fly every time he fluffed a line? What else can I do for your film?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just get your greedy little ass inside and make sure you give the performance of your life. (icily) This next number, I dedicate to you...dear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the three enter. The station is old with a high sergea and wooden benches against the walls. Raymond, beyond tea destroyed, sits among the other refuse of the night: dere stoned kids, etc. On one bench is a SAILOR, with that ade look that betrays the weakness he tries to hide with his arrogance. Jake, in the doorway of his office, savors the he has finally nailed Eli Cross. Eli captures the setup i glance...then, instant theater. He strides across the pol station to Raymond, takes his head in his hands and kisse on the mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (vehemently) Who's better, booby...him or me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe has come up behind a PATROLMAN, grabs him by the hip starts humping like a dog in heat. The policeman shrieks and tries to escape, but Gabe trots along as if they were

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting) Jake! Throw some water on him, quick! Only way to get 'em apart!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe is now distracted by the sight of the sailor, who is growing disbelief. Gabe ogles him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yummy...look at the seafood! You're a humpy little number. (then to Raymond, stamping his foot) You nasty boy. You could've died of mercury poisoning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sailor leaps to his feet in horror, screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, they're all faggots!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli has stormed to the counter and slams his fist down on furiously, confronting Jake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting) I'm registering a complaint! Thirty- two members of my company got V.D. from your local virgins. The Chamber of Commerce didn't say anything about that in their brochure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can stop clowning, Eli, I've got a sworn complaint from this sailor... (jabbing his finer in Raymond's O.S. direction) ...Your man over there touched his genitals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is snuggled against him tenderly, her open mouth kiss neck and cheek. Raymond, although aware of his desperate is too sick with self-loathing to respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jake! Come on! You wouldn't know your anal invert from a hole in the ground. Raymond makes bad jokes, but they're not illegal. Christ, you've seen us all on the set...clowning around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron stands, peering in through the big front window, once again betrayed. It's like watching TV with the sound From here, Nina and Raymond are very convincing. Chuck le against a lamppost, smoking a cigarette, as the charade g

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli now going full blast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My company's been pouring sixty thousand dollars a week into this place, for which your mayor and governor seem very grateful! We paid enough in taxes and fees alone to buy you parking meters from here to the boardwalk!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (feeling it's all going wrong) Everything I said in that statement is the flat-ass truth!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli pays no attention, knowing that he's got Jake.     He toward Nina embracing Raymond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake, I got a very horny leading lady who's got an early call and would like to spend some time with her boyfriend before she makes "night-night." Now, can I please get 'em outta here before they really do something illegal...and in front of witnesses!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's three o'clock in the morning. The corridors are empt elevator door swings open and Nina and Eli step out and m the hallway, functioning on their last ounce of nervous e

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry I had to put you through that. I know it was humiliating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...It was awful...I hated it.   But you did save that man's life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI Yeah, that was really nice of me. I'm a nice person. I just wish I had the strength to go to his room and break his spine. On the last day of filming the queen decides to come out of the closet! Wouldn't that have made a lovely headline? You understand, of course, that the film would've been destroyed. Doing that to me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NINA Eli, what's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI Nothing serious.     Just a little self-indulgence.     Feel-sorry-for- Eli-time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli, on the edge of nervous exhaustion, is actually close

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI (CONT'D) I'm sorry, but you know...it's too goddamn much. Why's everybody on my back? When's somebody gonna say, "There, there Eli?" I'm really surrounded by friends, allies and you..."What else can I do for your film, Eli?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NINA (wounded) That's not fair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have reached a turn in the corridor where each would separate way. They stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI What's not fair...getting my feelings "hurt?" When did I lose you to that soldier boy, Nina? That nice, wholesome, swell-looking kid...wanted by every cop, the FBI and God knows who else, for God knows what crime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina is paralyzed with shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Nina, those blue eyes have bedazzled our little girl. For Christ's sake, he reeks of blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sound as crazy as... (she stops)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wryly) As who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He thinks you're trying to... (she can't say 'kill') ...harm him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any number of people are trying to harm him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks off down the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Partly crated props and costumes, luggage belonging to th film crew is piled against the wall and on shelves. In th cavernous half-lit room, Cameron, once again the coiled, animal, moves through the shadows among the racks of suit pulling them aside, searching. Discovering one, he sets i floor. It's locked. With a metal bar, he breaks the lock eagerly rifles the contents. Then, sensing a presence, he There stands Nina at the base of the steps watching him. a glance to her, he goes on with his search.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you know I was down here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The desk clerk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He finds a WALLET, opens it, getting to his feet triumpha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about that for luck? Burt's from Idaho...no picture on the driver's license.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron stuffs the wallet in his pocket, moving along the suitcases. He pulls out a duffel bag, unzips it, shaking

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: contents on the floor. Now with the open bag on his arm, along the row of costumes and props like a man in the sup stuffing in things he will need: a pair of hiking boots, of work shirts, a heavy jacket. Passing a shelf of bayone picks one out and throws it in the bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring the seriousness) Name it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Above the bayonets are army helmets.    He tries one on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, how's this? A World War One, uh...what did they call 'em?... dogfaces... somethin'... doughboys. (flings a nurses uniform at her) Wanna be the nurse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 179A   From some hospital props, he grabs a wheelchair an her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...You tell me this wouldn't work? A pretty nurse pushing a vet in a wheelchair? When we hit that roadblock, we'd have 'em crying like babies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Who the hell are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody trying to stay alive...anybody--that can get past the dogs and the quicksand... (making a shrewd guess) Who did Eli say I was?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm asking you, God damn...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has fiercely grabbed his naked shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON Easy with that tatoo...it mighta lost me Eli, but it won me Lt. Emily Schmidt, the greatest boobs in Southeast Asia...and a very patriotic chick. So I got this tattoo, for 28 bucks. And when she saw this shoulder, let me tell ya, holy Jesus! Following which I got the clap from the Lt. And hepatitis from the tattoo needle. You know what bothers me? I think Emily is gonna be very offended by Eli's picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina cannot endure another moment of this charade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NINA Why do they want you?   What did you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON Eli'd tell you...I was a soldier. I did the same as everybody, just one of the boys... emptied my M-16 at any sound... don't know whether I killed gooks or cherries...the new kids from the States, we call 'em cherries, which they were for maybe fifteen minutes. The dry season is when it really breaks loose. You get very tired. It's like falling asleep at the wheel. You close your eyes and it still goes on. You're killin' them, they're killin' you. Couldn't tell ya now what was real except I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We sense in him the fatigue he is describing, then, pushi that memory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, once when things were rough and the grass ran out, I shot the hell out of a water buffalo. (he considers, then passes judgment on himself) Actually, I wasn't a bad soldier...better than most. Got lotsa pretty ribbons. Funny...sort of like when I did that first stunt and everybody started clapping... nothing like a slap on the back to ruin a man, blow his sense of proportion. So, I got home...and, uh...I guess I expected something. Nothing fancy, but... something, you know...a free car wash, double blue chip stamps, extra time on the parking meter... I don't know... Instead, people... uh, didn't seem too pleased. (trying to hide a lot of pain) In fact, they acted like I was gonna start killing babies...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She crosses to him, deeply moved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. I was supposed to get married, run an ice cream parlor. (picks up his suitcases) I gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 179B   Although they're standing only a couple of feet ap hand tentatively, as if to wave goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...What about the roadblocks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go through the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you suppose there'll be cops in the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose there are cops in the woodwork! But what the hell...it's a nice night. (he starts to go)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lovers facing farewells have a gift for suspending time, speaks out, unable to let him leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've always liked the woods at night. They're very romantic... You can hunt for truffles. It might be such fun, we'd just keep going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron can't afford to fall for her softness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said "we." What about your two scenes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's true...One of them is three pages of me making a tunafish salad for an American flyer in 1917... And I've got to weigh that against losing the man I love. It's a big decision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina, you're making me crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I'm a little crazy myself. I can't let you go and I don't even know who you are. (suddenly the dam bursts and all self-control is gone) Why are they chasing you?! What have you done? What happens to me in the woods? Will I need a bayonet too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 179C   He stands there, staring at her, his face suddenly everything, the lady is afraid of him. He picks up the du and moves for the door, then turns on her, punishing her words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The charge was attempted murder. I bashed this cop's head in. It took the jury about two fucking minutes. It could of been worse. It could of been life. But the judge...he looked real nice at me, and said you were a damn good soldier, son...So he only gave me twenty years. No way! Enough!...You know how long I was in that prison -- nineteen months -- and then I was gone! I was gone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares in shock and horror.   His anger is like ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caught me breaking into a store...oh, not to rob it...I went there to kill the bastard who owned it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Because...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 179D   Suddenly the ice turns to steam. His self-control glass. There in the basement of a 100-year old hotel, bef audience of one, Cameron ERUPTS, spewing out the memory o mortification and crucifixion...not without the silent re of Jesus, but with the howling rage of a mad dog...Pluto rabies...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Because...it seemed like a good idea to twist his fucking head off! Said I could be his partner when I got back...lyin' son of a bitch was "real sorry things were slack..." Slack my ass...he just didn't want me hangin' around because he was bangin' my old lady. So I go down and start bangin' on his door! (he starts pounding on the mirror)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...He's closed. It's two o'clock in the morning. I want to smash his face in and he's closed! "OPEN UP, YOU BASTARD."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 179E   Cameron's fist SMASHES his own face in the dressin His reflection crazes and falls to pieces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) Your hand!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron holds up his fist to her, shaking it in glee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bang! That bright, shiny front window went bye-bye! (reveling in his own insanity) ...Maybe he's screwin' her behind the counter...I climb in there screamin' "WHERE ARE YA? Come out here and be a man! Where are ya? Behind that counter, you son-of-a- bitch?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron kicks over the makeup table as though it were the counter...tubes and glasses shatter all over the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya know what's behind that counter?... (the ultimate horror) ...41-DIFFERENT-KINDS-OF-ICE CREAM..." and all that fuckin' SYRUP!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 179F   There is a rainbow row of makeup jars and hair tin HURLING them against the wall where they smash, punctuati speech with bursts of gooey color.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...And these little Mickey Mouse faces on the walls!...with candy eyeballs!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pauses, catching his breath, as another image emerges swirl of memory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tense and frightened) ...Then...I see this thing glowing in the dark...I hit that floor so fast. Christ, I nearly swallowed my heart. That second I was sure...it was Charlie...a cigarette butt, some guy on a V.C. Patrol!... (his panic subsides) Know what it was? It was the GODDAMN PILOT LIGHT ON THE HOT FUDGE MACHINE!! That did it! That DID IT! HOT FUDGE?! Me buried in shit, being the damn good soldier the judge said I was, yes sir, people sitting there on their fat asses feedin' their fat faces. "Can I have an extra cherry? Can I have an extra cherry?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron rips Denise's electric hair dryer from the wall a across the basement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I smashed that fucking fudge pot across the room, smack into that shelf full of animals...and it starts raining pussycats and monkeys and kangaroo cookies like Noah's Ark!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The   hair dryer smashes against a shelf, toppling ammuni and   bottles onto the carcass of a disassembled World Wa The   propeller topples and falls through a German recrui and   just out at the Kaiser's crotch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "How long should a girl wait" she says? FOR GODDAMN EVER, BITCH, THAT'S HOW LONG!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron's hands have come to rest on a metal laundry bin. it and lifts it over his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I picked up this fifty-pound ice cream vat...FLAVOR-OF-THE-MONTH!... ROYAL-BAVARIAN-CHOCOLATE-MIST!...and I started running with that son-of- a-bitch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron starts running across the room and just as he's a hurl it, he COLLIDES with a jutting shelf, which knocks h his back. The shelf falls and thirty or forty one-gallon cascade on top of him. It looks disastrous. Nina runs to terrified, but before the last can has even come to rest, emerges from the pile of cans, throwing them aside, still and screaming as he struggles to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the sight of him, Nina starts laughing. But Cameron, w somehow managed to keep his grip on the laundry basket, r over his head as if nothing has happened, hurls the cloth screaming:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the effort, Cameron's feet fly out from under him as stepped in oil. In fact, he has stepped in paint, and lan his ass in the green goo. Nina "bracks" out an uncontroll guffaw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON (bellowing) It's not funny!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shamed, Nina runs to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NINA Oh, baby...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, as she reaches him, her feet too are caught in the p she slides forward like an ice skater, spraddling him, la her ass. His rage vanishes as he points at her, breaking fiendish, uncontrollable cackle. These pratfalls are a ca that has released the pressure and the madness. They atte gain their feet, skidding and sliding in the paint. He su but Nina fails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NINA (through laughter) Let me go to the bathroom.   I'm gonna have an accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON You'll miss the main part! Killer Cameron's ghastly crime! I was freaked out of my head! And, suddenly there's this big flashlight shining in my face. I just grabbed that goddamn ice cream bucket and slopped it...right over the guy's head!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Although Cameron's got nothing in his hands, he pantomime that fifty-pound ice cream bucket around in the air, losi balance and landing on his back in the paint beside Nina. hysteria is renewed, but Cameron stops laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON (CONT'D) (quietly) It's not funny. It wasn't him. It was a cop. I got out of there like a shot. I didn't know he was knocked out. How the hell did I know he was gonna lay there all night with his head in the ice cream?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NINA (suddenly serious) Oh, my God. He died?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON No, he's in the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NINA Oh, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON Oh, yes.   That ice cream's goddamn cold! (struggling for a proper description) His nose...it froze and his ear froze, see...and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Despite the horror of it, Nina starts giggling.   She can

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON (CONT'D) (indignantly) No, it's terrible!...He lost the tip of his nose and his ear lobe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 179H   Then, Cameron, realizing the absurdity, starts gig control, Nina scrambles to her feet and dashes for the la Cameron follows her to the door, still talking as it clos her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell ya, it's a bad year to mess with cops. You get the FBI screaming down on your ass...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through the door) Oh, God. Too late...Thanks a lot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abruptly, Cameron's energy is gone. The hilarity is over. his forehead against the door in exhaustion and despair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) ...If we woke up Eli and told him about the ice cream...would he forgive me and call off the stunt?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DUESENBERG STANDS silhouetted in the darkness, light dimly off it like the gleam from fine wood of a splendid waiting in the slumber room before services begin. Behind side door of the garage opens. But it is not visitors com their last respects, it is Cameron and Nina. He is wearin clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina moves quickly to a WHITE CONVERTIBLE as Cameron cros big overhead garage doors and hits the electric SWITCH. N HAPPENS. He flips another switch and harsh overhead light illuminate the reality of the garage. Nina has started th convertible, as Cameron tries to lift the garage door han

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the hell d'ya open this thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, folks, it's locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina gasps. Cameron whirls towards the voice. A COP with flashlight stands in the open doorway peering in at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We know it's locked.   Would you open up for us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't...not 'til seven o'clock.   Mr. Cross's orders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (the actress) I'm sure Mr. Cross will understand when you tell him that Miss Franklin had a sudden desire for Swedish pancakes for breakfast and this gentleman had a sudden desire to keep me company...I'm Nina Franklin, the star of the film.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pancake house don't open 'til eight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all right, we'll find some place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Town's closed up pretty tight this time of night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we'll drive to Cape Long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya'll never get through the roadblocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief's orders. Mr. Cross didn't want any members of the company leavin' town tonight. Guess he wanted everybody good and rested for the last day. (he grins) Figure it's no secret about the Chief hopin' this is the last day...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NINA (fiercely) Are you telling me that if I decide to take a drive at any time of the day or night or whenever I damn please, I need Mr. Cross's permission? Mr. Cross does not control me or anyone else, including this gentleman and he does not control the public roads!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COP No, but the police do. I'll wake Mr. Cross up and ask him if you want, but it's an awful hour. Should be somebody in the hotel kitchen by now. I'll get 'em to rustle somethin' up for you. Maybe not pancakes, but eggs, if you want it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON I think the lady had her heart set on pancakes, but thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COP Okay. You change your mind, call... I'll be around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leaves. The officer is gone and so is their plan. They limbo...people in a waiting room whose flight has been ca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON I can't believe it...He knows. The son-of-a-bitch knows whatever I'm thinking. I'm beginning to feel like something that Sam wrote! I'm not real. I'm some jerk American flyer from World War I who has to go over a bridge and die because the goddamn script says so! It's crazy...I'm trapped in his goddamn story. If somebody lost that page, I'd be fine. If he crossed it out and wrote something else like -- "At the last moment, he veers the big car from the railing--then goes speeding on to live happy ever after..." (he looks at the Duesenberg appraisingly, then grins as a plan starts to form) ...How about that?! Empty road, me out there all alone, the crew 'way back, breathless as I approach the bridge. And then..."Hey, what happened?!" A fucking rewrite's what happened! I'll have a fifteen- minute jump on them before they figure out they're shooting a new version!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina has come to life, her eyes aglow like a shrewd littl who's already decided how the fairy tale will end!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NINA ...And what about the love story? What happens to the Austrian girl? People will leave the movie feeling terrible...I know! She goes with him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina has walked around to the back of the Duesenberg and TRUNK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NINA In here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cautiously) Not bad. But, I think they arrange to meet later...like in a Greyhound Bus station a couple of towns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NINA No...look... (she climbs in) See how big it is? Comfortable, too...Honestly, honey, it's a better ending.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON (firmly) Nina, get out of the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pretending has ended.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NINA And what happens in the morning? Do I show up on the set in my little pink pinafore and say, "Hi, Eli. Where's my hug and kiss...?" How do I do that now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON (sternly) ...Get out of the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NINA ...Or should I trot up to my room to catch a couple of winks and cuddle up with a dozen sleeping pills?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON (angry) It's my nightmare...Stay out! This isn't the time to solve your neurotic problems! I'm trying to stay alive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NINA (shouting back) So am I. And I never claimed not to have "neurotic problems!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON (interrupting) Oh, for Christ's sake...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...They come with the body!    It's all one. A package deal!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shouting ends...and in despairing silence, VOICES of WORKMEN are heard, grumbling that the coffee's late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (urgent whisper) Nina, please, there's somebody coming. Get out of the trunk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we glimpse the WORKMEN in the doorway, she reaches up, inside of the trunk lid and pulls it down, disappearing f as the trunk slams shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the stillness, as the morning sun crests the trees, th move like a parting curtain, leaving sunlight to warm the of the abandoned road. The ancient bridge spans the black idling toward the sea. It is a perfect day, tranquil exce faint distant "rumbling" intruding into our consciousness grows louder and LOUDER, a flock of birds is frightened f trees, a rusty beer can by the roadside begins to tremble from the vibration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rounding the bend of the road into view are a half-dozen bicycles, peddling furiously, laughing and yelling and lo at what now appears behind them: the first vehicle of an carnival parade -- or is it a funeral procession? Long, s tall, fat vehicles; the stretch-out car, the cab towing p toilets, the tractor pulling a generator rig, the Cortez dressing rooms, the stake-bed loaded with reflectors ratt radar screens, panel trucks with studio emblems, a vintag army truck filled with soldiers, patrol cars and motorcyc huge, bright yellow construction crane on its Caterpillar its pneumatic snout jutting forward thirty yards like a m hard-on sniffing around for some tunnel to hump -- a few straddle it having their morning Danish and coffee. In th these, on a low-slung flatbed trailer rides the Duesenber coffin on its caisson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The caravan grinds, hisses, wheezes to a halt and the A.D the hood of the first vehicle, dismounts and raises his e bullhorn to begin what will be an incessant squawking of instructions, reprimands, coaxings and complaints.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, people...the rest period is over. Another fifteen minutes and we start losing sun. Come on, let's get the equipment off those trucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Second A.D.'s run around like sheepdogs herding the l snapping at their flanks, barking their instructions over horns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuck...Chuck Barton, where do you want the Duesenberg?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grips and laborers are carrying the big reflectors throug into the hills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Cross, please. The camera crew's ready for a setup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are already huddled, squatting on their haunches und

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The R-35 in the chopper on the maxi- mount, the underwater Imo in the Duesenberg...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll hide an Arri with a zoom up on the hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what about number four? Maybe hang a platform under the bridge with the speed camera?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (admiringly) Heavy...From the top of the screen right into the water...squish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Being rolled up to a mark in the center of the road. Crew in and under it, tuning, polishing, testing, installing c sound, electrical equipment, as Chuck hovers over them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All drivers, please...I want every equipment vehicle back behind the bend...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As motors rev, the two sheepdogs squawk: "Out of sight... the bend...," then are lost in the rising dust of their h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cables are being strung out of sight along the side of th snapped into junction boxes that spread their electrified strangling the landscape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing at the mike boom) What's that supposed to be, Ralph? ...An elm or an oak? Get that mike off the boom and into the bushes. Come on, people, let's think! We're losing the sun!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabe, Chuck, the A.D. and a Technician move down the road shoulder to shoulder, halting on the bridge. Chuck and Ga the stone railing. Chuck taps on it, producing a hollow s Gabe, examining a corner of this false section...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to A.D.) Have 'em touch up that corner of the section. It looks phony as hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The A.D. has been drawing a chalk line across the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Technician) Climb down there in the bushes and stay out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about earphones?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just watch your mark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind it, the last of the equipment trucks is being jack of sight. A row of reflectors stand like sentinels on the bathing the Duesenberg in light. Workmen swarm about it l on the queen's birthday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into walkie-talkie) Where's the chopper? We'd kinda like to have you join us...if you can find the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over walkie-talkie) Fifteen minutes, Eli. We're just warming her up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli grabs an electric horn from the hand of a passing A.D

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, everybody...may I have your attention, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instantly the frantic A.D.'s begin squawking, "Everybody what you're doing, the director wants to talk."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thru speaker) This is the one and only Duesenberg we have in stock. When that car goes into the water, we're not going to see it again. So, once the action starts, no matter what happens, keep it going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Cameron steps out through the open doorway, buttoning costume.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...We must have this shot. Therefore, I now order no camera to jam and no cloud to pass before the sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Cameron moves toward it uncertainly. Eli, some distanc surrounded by members of his crew, glances up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling) How ya doin', soldier? Where'd ya learn to do without sleep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without awaiting an answer, Eli returns to his work, as C approaches the Duesenberg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron walks around it, testing and checking, but moving relentlessly toward the humpback trunk. A horn honks and car slides up. Jake leans out the window, waves at Camero jovially.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you guys get accident insurance? Must cost you an arm and a leg... (chuckling) ...that's a good one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drives on toward a parked German army truck, in which several soldiers. Chuck approaches Cameron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're lookin' real strong, kid. Is that loose change I hear jinglin' or are they beginnin' to grow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flatly) Wanna check?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, lemme show you this truck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk towards the German truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sending it on ahead. During the gag, it's gonna be comin' down the road towards you when you get to the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron tenses at this information.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, what does it change? I'm only tellin' you so you don't buzz off into space when you see 'em. They'll be shooting at you and that's what's supposed to make you go into the river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 190A   They've reached the truck where Jake stands proudl Man is handing out rifles and boxes of bullets to the Ger soldiers, whom we now recognize as police officers from t One cop, tying his shoe, lifts his head and grins at Came old buddy -- the officer from the garage last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you ever get those pancakes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...My boys...Can't recognize 'em. How could I say no, after all the crap they've taken because of this company the last six weeks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (good-naturedly) Yeah, a cop'll do anything for fifty bucks, even be an actor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These guns are kinda modern for World War I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Chuck) You want me to drive back and get the old ones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deciding) Shit...forget it. How much'll they see from the helicopter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If Cameron was upset by the change in the stunt, he is no unnerved by the sight of those cops with guns. The second loading cartridges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (starting back to Duesenberg) Hope those are really blanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chuckling) Don't say so on the box!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Cameron arrives and casually leans against the trunk a gently taps. He must get Nina out of there. With determin reaches for the trunk handle. Arms wearing the same costu own reach in, holding the trunk closed. It is Raymond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No need to look... If she loves you, she's still there. If she doesn't...then it doesn't really matter...does it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can he know?     -- Everything is out of control -- a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Lucky, we need you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns and moves numbly to the car door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in, will ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dazed, Cameron climbs behind the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leaning in passenger's side) Look straight ahead, can you see that red light out of the corner of your eye?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tiny red light is mounted in the corner over the windsh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'll let you know when the film's running, so be sure you don't turn your face to the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The technician tightens a final screw on the red light th back out of the car, yells O.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TECHNICIAN (CONT'D) All right, bump it once. (to Cameron) Does it work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron, barely hearing, looks straight ahead without res Jake lounges at the driver's window, kibitzing the operat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TECHNICIAN (CONT'D) (yells O.S.) Bump it again. (looks back into the car)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON (by reflex) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The words "CAMERA ON" sound exactly like "CAMERON." It so though his real name was called and he automatically answ his identity been exposed? His eyes widen. The technician no response, calls to Jake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TECHNICIAN Ask him if it's on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE Cameron?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He whirls to see Jake staring at him. His hand darts to t ignition key, the engine roars to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE (CONT'D) (startled) Hey, they wanna know is the CAMERA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron realizes his error, but it's too late, he's in a his mind, he's given himself away. The road ahead is clea He jams the car in gear and slams the accelerator to the Duesenberg leaps forward, screeching wildly. In its wake Everyone running, yelling...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHUCK (yelling) That crazy bastard!     Who cued him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A.D.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cold; urgent) Roll! Roll the film! Move your asses -- I want that shot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At their master's voice, they leap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screams) End markers!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts) Speed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed. The needle hits sixty-five -- seventy -- climbing Cameron grips the wheel, looking at that empty road. An i shout swells up and escapes his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exultantly) Yahooo! (toward Nina in the trunk) Hang on to everything, baby, we're on our way! You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The needle hits eighty -- eighty-five. Ahead, the bridge toward us. Now the arches of the stone railing are strobi Through them, he sees the black river which he has escape Triumphantly, his hand rises, middle finger extended. Sud red camera light goes on, the underwater camera behind hi whirring. He moves his finger behind him for a perfect cl (recalling that moment in the tower):

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) Shoot this, Eli!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The center of the bridge is an instant away, an approachi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crouching -- tensely watching the chalk line on the road Duesenberg flashes past. His finger presses a button. 195

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blam! The whole front wheel of the car is blown off by an charge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Duesenberg drops on one axle. Metal screams against s though it were Cameron himself, screaming. Skidding, spin tearing through the papier-mache railing, plunging out of into space, where it hovers for a brief instant and arcs like a dying bird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cry of such anguish and despair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) Ninaaa-a-a-a-a-!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The river rushes up and the car smashes into it with a de shattering roar, plunging beneath the surface to a dark a soundless world -- except for a tiny red light, the whir and Cameron's desperate cries. Tearing his seatbelt off h himself toward the rear of the car, clawing at the back s reach Nina. Incredibly, there is sunlight again as the ca buoyed to the surface. There, again, is the living world road, the trees. In that brief instant, through the rear Cameron has a wild, tilted glimpse of a pink pinafore -- standing by the rail looking down, Eli beside her. The ca downward, water rising swiftly over the rear window. The on Cameron's retina is that wild, eager, little-girl exci Nina's face. Then he's alone again, entombed in the darke as the car plunges toward the bottom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron sits, immobilized at the realization that his bet total. Everyone, even Nina, has conspired to bring him to red light glowing, camera whirring, to capture the moment death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outrage galvanizes him to action. He reaches for the door to rip them open -- they snap off in his hands. Now there rumbling and rending of metal as the roof begins to implo crushing down toward him. Under the immense pressure, the window bursts inward, the river rushing in a wild torrent memory of Chuck's voice..."the windows." He lowers the fr slowly. The water now pours in faster. The level has rise chin. He gasps a final breath and the water rises over hi Still the red light burns. He reaches beneath the seat fo oxygen cylinder and tries to pull it loose. It won't move impact of the car hitting the water has bent the seat fra groping hand finds the hose, the oxygen mask. A hope. Tho second is robbing his chance for life, his movements unde as in slow motion. Pulling the mask to his face, he takes breath and chokes as water fills his mouth. The rubber tu broken loose from the cylinder and is floating free -- as have with Burt. Pressure of the onrushing water has stopp water reaches the roof. For a moment there is a strange s which Cameron, his lungs bursting, swims through, out the toward the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moving upward through river slime, in a world that grows a desperate race to reach air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daylight! Gasping, half unconscious, barely able to move to stay afloat. Adrift in the current, he touches land, c the rocks and pulling himself onto the shore. His muscles moving by motor reflex, driven by survival instinct, take crawling from the river bank through the tall grass -- st fugitive, the "man on the run." Then, he lifts his head a at what he sees before him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fanned out across the field is a row of men, guns held re Policemen from the truck in their German uniforms moving slowly -- carefully searching the terrain in an arch whic closes, must irrevocably reach Cameron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's over. Without strength or will, he lies waiting for though his eyes were made of glass. They see him now, but pace doesn't change. As they take the last few steps towa sees their shoulders, waists, knees and then only a circl around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their hands roughly grab him, pulling him to his feet, sh brutally about. Angry cop faced growling: "Kill the son-o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: bitch," "Shoot 'im," "Cut it," "Hang 'im," and then loudl it!" He feels a blow on the back, then another. They seem gentle. Why is that cop smiling? Some of them are walking Where are the handcuffs? Why is he shaking my hand instea the jumble of voices is becoming clearer..."No matter wha you, make 'em give you a raise!"..."Fantastic, my wife th a cop is dangerous -- you guys are terrific!" It finally the insane, absurd, devastating, humiliating realization all just another scene in a movie that came off as planne

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is alive and free. Is that gurgle we hear in Cameron's the water that he swallowed or an unseemly giggle? Then i into laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here comes Chuck, running across the field with his silly filled with elastic bandages. How funny. Here's the helic hovering with Gabe descending the rope ladder bearing fil who runs to meet him. How hilarious. There's the pink pinafore...Nina holding the skirt up to her waist as she through the tall grass towards him. How sweetly absurd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, come on...let's get the stuff in the trucks, we're losing sun!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuck has reached Cameron, throwing a blanket over him. pint from his back pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a belt. Don't be stingy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Cameron tilts his head back, the bottle to his mouth, skin divers setting down their rescue equipment and strip their dripping wet-suits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those guys down there the whole time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuck, who is rubbing Cameron violently through the blank restore his circulation, replies with the highest complim pay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't hear ya...they're clangin' too loud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina has reached an impasse twenty yards away in her jour toward Cameron -- a muddy section of swamp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts across the distance to Cameron) I can't come any further. What should I do? I'll get the dress all muddy and I need it for the next scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grinning with good nature) Tunafish salad...I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts) They found me five minutes after you left. I felt ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waves back) Just as well!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts) When Eli told me you'd   changed your mind and decided to do   the stunt, at first I didn't believe   him, but I guess you really did.    I tried to find you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli is standing nearby listening to this macabre exchange lovers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to include Eli) I'm sure glad you two made up! Boy, Lucky, were you wonderful...I guess I have to go now. See you after.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She awkwardly turns, her dress still held high and yells her shoulder...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I was so nutty last night. I always get crazy at the end of a film.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina continues picking her way toward the road.   And the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly she turns, running headlong, pell-mell across th through the mud holes, drenching her pink pinafore into a losing a shoe, ripping her hose -- and then wildly into t Cameron, smearing him with love and mud! And then, just a she is gone, racing back across the field, hopping like a without her shoe, toward the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron is brimming with pleasure.    Chuck, totally igno his stunt bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dryly) Lover, I think your circulation's back to normal. And please, next time will ya listen for the cue -- the word is "action."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks off, leaving Cameron draped in the blanket like Eli steps up to him looking very serious, lifts his hand Indian sign of greeting and says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "How!" I have always had a great compassion for your people. Long before it was popular, I felt a repugnance for General Custer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameron stares at him, incredulous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God, I think he's breathing. There're days I can't do anything right. I hope this doesn't screw up our relationship, your being alive and all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON (shaking his head) ...You sure took a hell of a chance, Eli...why didn't you just let me go last night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI What, with Nina in the trunk? I've got scenes to shoot with her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON ...All right. This morning then. Chuck could have done the stunt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI (thoughtfully) I knew a guy who made an anti-war film. When they previewed it in his hometown, army enlistment went up six hundred percent. I'm making this film trying to convince the whole world that maybe there's a better way to get home for Thanksgiving...and I can't even convince one dumb kid with a tattoo...I couldn't have you run around paranoid the rest of your life thinking I was trying to kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON Paranoid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam has run up, out of breath, followed by crew members.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI Hey Sam, the kid just licked your screenplay. He named the disease.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAM Yeah, what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI ...a social disease, very common.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAM ...like gonorrhea...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI You're close. It's spread the same way...by screwing your fellow man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON I hope you find an easier cure. That was the hardest thousand bucks I ever made.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A horn honks. It is Jake who, in his enthusiasm, has driv police car bumping over the marshes to Eli and Cameron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE You guys want a ride back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI (moving toward the helicopter) No, we're goin' in the chopper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON (considers it) Thanks, Eli, but that looks too dangerous. I think I'll ride with Jake. Good luck with the picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves toward police car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI (yelling to Cameron) Don't miss that plane, Burt!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAKE (leaning across Cameron to yell at Eli) He better not! Any member of your company found within city limits after five o'clock tonight, gets shot on sight!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli stops, suddenly registering what Cameron had said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI ...What thousand bucks?   That stunt paid six-fifty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON (surprised) Chuck told me a thousand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (firmly) Six-fifty!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON (getting upset) A thousand!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI (relenting) Okay, seven-fifty.      Split the difference...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON Bullshit!   You're trying to screw me!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI (exasperated) Christ! You're doing it again! (striding toward the chopper, shouting) Sam! This paranoid little bastard still doesn't understand your damn screenplay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli is climbing into the helicopter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON (shrieking) That's your big problem, Eli! You use people! I want my money, a thousand bucks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELI (to Cameron) Six-fifty!! (to Sam) Rewrite the battle scene and let the tank run him over! The stunt pays six-fifty!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopter takes off, zooms under the bridge, up into hammerhead and soars back, while Cameron continues to scr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERON Come back here. I'm tired of being your goddamn clown! Pay me my thousand bucks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eli's voice on the helicopter's P.A. speaker echoes throu canyon, as the chopper cavorts overhead and skims away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How tall was King Kong...
